story:
My mom was diagnosed with  Multiple Sclerosis in 2003. Multiple Sclerosis is a neurological disease where the body's immune system destroys the "coating" on nerves causing a number of physical problems. Luckily we lived  in San Diego, CA where the temperatures were mild year round and did cause any problems with her MS.

 In October of 2003 , we lost our home in the Cedar Fire and after our insurance company screwed us out of most of our insurance pay off, we moved to Texas where we had family and we could afford to start over.

Three days ago the Air Conditioner broke. Temperatures in TX are presently at 100+. Any temperature over 70 degrees makes all her symptoms significantly worse. She's having severe trouble walking, using her hands,  feeding herself etc.

About a week ago we payed off my brother's next semester at college, leaving nothing in our savings.  I caretake for her full time and therefore don't have time for a paying job.

Absolutely any help you could give us would be so wonderful. We have to get the air conditioner back up and running.

story:
A Summary

Hi everyone! The Guyanese people need your help. Guyana, on the north coast of South America, is a small country, still developing with resources that must be stretched among many competing needs. As a result, there is a shortage of available dollars to provide for the medical needs of the entire population. Ashley Menzies, Brittany McClerkin, and Liz Fisseha are traveling to Guyana to volunteer with Guyana Medical Relief (GMR), a nonprofit that raises funds to provide support for medical-related needs in Guyana.  

Ashley’s grandmother, Eula Menzies, founded Guyana Medical Relief in 1984. As the daughter of one of the few physicians in Guyana, Eula witnessed the plight of her people including the lack of access to basic needs such as clean drinking water. Guyana is one of the poorest countries in South America and the Caribbean. Parents fear that their children will not have access to the medicine they need. Many still live in areas that do not have clean drinking water. Simple procedures are difficult to perform due to the lack of resources. Ashley is determined to continue her grandmother’s legacy by giving back to the people of Guyana. Most of the organization is run by her grandmother's peers, and they need the younger generation to step up and further GMR's cause. Your contribution will literally save lives and strengthen a community in need. 


The Impact

Your contribution will go directly to strengthening GMR's impact. Guyana Medical Relief has expanded its initiative from servicing two hospitals to supporting eight. In the last year, it has provided over $8 million worth of pharmaceuticals and medical supplies to hospitals and clinics in need. It has built three VIA Clinics, each of which cost $25,000 to build. These clinics provide free cervical cancer screening and follow-up services for women. In addition, GMR has formed a partnership with TOMS Shoes to provide shoes and medical check-ups for children in rural areas. Its goal is to expand its services as well as the number of hospitals and VIA Clinics it supports. 

What We Need 

In order to reach these goals, the organization needs continued financial support and a younger team to further its mission and impact. Our goal is to raise $10,000. Funds will support GMR's initiatives listed above, such as the necessary equipment hospitals need to provide adequate treatment to its patients, our service trip, and a revamp of the organization. This year is Guyana Medical Relief's 30th anniversary. We hope to help build GMR with a young, motivated team with innovative ideas and a fresh perspective. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not in a position to provide a financial contribution, please share our campaign with your friends, family, and colleagues. We really appreciate your support!

story:
Short Summary

Major Moves Athletics was founded by Patrice Reed.  Coach Patrice has been coaching for 11 years. She has coached boys and girls, from 2nd grade to 10th grade at all skill levels. Shes’s coached at the Boys and Girls Club, MAYB, AAU and a Magnet School.  Coach Patrice has a passion for basketball and knows that it is something that God has blessed her with.  She understands that her purpose in life is tied to it. She considers coaching basketball to be a fulfillment of that purpose.

Coach Reed wants to provide every player with a solid foundation first, then build upon that. She feels that some programs lack teaching the fundamentals. That is why private sessions are so important because she can build on a player’s strengths and strengthen a player’s weaknesses in an environment that is not intimidating.  She evaluates each player first and she also allows each player to express what his/her goals are and what the athlete would like to accomplish.

She reinforces the concept of the brain being the most important muscle not just in basketball, but in life. Not only does she teach players the game of basketball, but they learned life lessons, such as responsibility, accountability, teamwork, sacrifice, discipline and consequences for their actions. She encourages players not to give up and she do not want anyone to miss out on his/her dreams due to a lack of confidence or support.

Although we currently offer basketball skills and agility training, we are expanding to add more sports and fitness classes.

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Short Summary

The island of Jamaica is experiencing an epidemic of the Chikingunya virus.  This virus is spread by mosquitoes and everyone is a potential victim.  So far, 5 people have died although in most cases the virus is not fatal.  
Pandadol and other non asprin tablets are the recommended action and at this time it is almost impossible to find these medications anywhere.  
At Nanny Hills Roots, we have examined the symptoms and effects of this horrific flu like virus and have created a natural blend of herbs that will address all of the symptoms while building the immune system.   We have named this blend 5N1.   Our plan is to create 500 packages of 5N1, each containing the ingredients for 10 cups of tea.  These will be distributed in high risk areas such as inner cities, schools and communities in 'high risk' mosquito breeding areas.
Your contribution will enable us at to ease the suffering of hundreds of people who do not have access to over the counter pain relievers or who in general, will not take standardized medicine.
If successful with this first roll out, we will intensify our outreach to serve a larger number of people who were not reached in our first efforts.

What We Need & What You Get

We hope to raise the funds necessary to purchase the required herbs, packaging materials and distribution costs.   

The cost of the herbs necessary for this blend, together with packaging,  will cost approximately $ 700.  Jamaica has an excellent courier service, TARA, that will enable us to get the product to almost anywhere on the island.  An individual in that community will receive the herbs and distribute them.  $300 should cover the costs of this service, gas and taxi fares to ensure that this product makes it to those in the most need.

Every contribution comes with a perk and this may be the perfect time to sample one of our products or if you are already a customer, to get some free products.

Any funds received from this campaign will be invested in the distribution of this product and it will be completely free to the person/persons receiving  these packages.

    The Impact

    Elleston Wright, aka Prophet Ashanti, has been a bush doctor in Jamaica for almost 30 years and his medicine has saved hundreds of lives.  His knowledge of the medicinal plants on this island has been handed down through  centuries and he has perfected this blend of tea to counter the adverse effects of chikingunya as well as other diseases and maladies.

    This new 5N1 herbal blend for treating the symptoms of Chikingunya has been tested and proven on 6 people who have had this virus and attest to the fact that the tea lowered their fevers, reduced joint pain and calmed the rash that often accompanies the virus.

      Risks & Challenges

      We feel confident that this project will successfully relieve the symptoms and suffering of people infected with the Chikingunya virus.  Nanny Hills Roots has a long history of satisfied clients and will continue to study the effects of natural herbal medicine to treat other illnesses.  Our strength is in building strong immune systems that allow self healing to occur. 

        Other Ways You Can Help

        We know that some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean that you can't help: Here's how

        Please share this campaign with all of your folks on email or other social medias.  It's easy and every click counts towards putting this campaign of the front page.  

        Thanks in advance for all of your support!

story:
One of the cruelest tragedies of this world we live in is that bad things do happen to good people sometimes....On the night of Wednesday ,November 12th 2014 this happened to the Beard family when their home where they have lived for over 15 yrs and raised their 3 children burnt to the ground destroying most all of their possessions and taking the life of their pet. Fortunately none of the family were present during the fire, but the house was a total loss.

The Beards have been a part of my life as long as I can remember and are some of the kindest, most generous people I have ever encountered. Due to the fact that the only thing keeping me from calling them family is the blood that runs through my veins I am spearheading this campaign fundraiser to help my lifetime friends Craig, Beth, Haley, Evan and Alex Beard get back on their feet. 

So if you can donate anything to help this family during these troublesome times I, and they, would be eternally grateful to you. If you can't donate right now, that is perfectly fine, just share the link to this page on your facebook and email the link to your friends and family.

The Beards have been giving to their community for years and asked for nothing in return...lets give some back.

Thank you and God bless.

story:
Aroma Robes 

With today's busy lifestyle and everyday stresses, the Aroma Robe is a personal, luxurious garment with healing powers designed to bring spa-like relaxation right into your home.

What is Aroma Robes

Aroma Robes is a one-of-a-kind product that fuses the familiar comfort of spa robes with aromatherapy. Our uniquely designed robes bring the healing power of aromatherapy to the millions of people who use robes on a daily basis. Aroma Robes customers are now able to transform small moments of relaxation into mindful, therapeutic sessions, bringing spa luxury to your home.

Though we pride ourselves in innovation, quality is still Aroma Robes focal point. Our microfiber robes are silk to the touch and our Nature’s Creation Neck Wraps contain 100% natural oils and herbs. Aroma Robes will expand its products to include essential oils, mists, soaps and other aromatherapy options.

Perks*

*Our Large Aroma Robes are One Size Fits Most and available in 9 colors. Please leave a comment specifying S, M, L, XL, XXL - and the color - once you've made your pledge.

*Our Large Terry Robes are One Size Fits Most. Please leave a comment specifying S, M, L, XL or XXL once you've made your pledge. Terry Robes available in White only.

*All Aroma Robes pre-orders will include the Lavender herbal packs.

*If you already have a PayPal account, you MUST log into your PayPal account during checkout in order to make a contribution.

Available Sizes & Colors

Aromatherapy Benefits

Aromatherapy is the use of essential oils and natural aromatic botanicals for psychological and physical well-being. Its origins can be traced back to a 5,000-year-old Indian healing system known as Ayurveda. Incorporating aromatherapy into your daily life now may ultimately prevent disease or feelings of imbalance.

Aroma Robes provides access to natural healing on a personalized, individual basis. Each aroma herb pack contains a specific plant with its own unique healing properties – including lavender for rejuvenation, chamomile for restoration and cinnamon for stimulation. Wearers may also treat soreness or chronic pain by heating or cooling our temperature-retaining neck and back wraps.

Robe and Herbal Pack Construction

How to use the Aroma Robes Herbal Packs

Heating and Cooling

Our Herbal Packs may be heated in the microwave or cooled in the freezer in order to enhance the aromas and maximize their effect. We also suggest storing Herbal Packs in the freezer for ultimate shelf life.

Cervical Region (Neck)

Designed specifically for the base of the neck, our botanical filled neck wraps are an effective and natural pain relief solution. They may be used hot or cold to relieve muscle aches and reduce stiffness around the neck area and relieve minor headaches originating from the base of the head. The aroma will also travel to the nose, soothing emotional stress, sinus problems and asthma. It can be used while sleeping, reading or traveling – giving you the ultimate comfort.

Lumbar Region (Back)

When heated, this herbal pack relieves back muscle pain and aches, abdominal pain and cramps, minor joint pain and promotes overall relaxation. When cooled it relieves back injuries, joint and tendon pain, minor burns and bruises, swelling and fever.

How Our Aromas Help You

The Aroma Robes Story

Leisurelife has tremendous experience in the robe and garment industry. Now we are ready to use our knowledge and passion to develop the world’s first Aroma Robe.

To manufacture the Aroma Robe we have lined up a world class sourcing company ready to coordinate all stages of production and logistics in Los Angeles. Our team is committed to delivering the highest quality Aroma Robe, right to your doorstep.

We have our exclusive design, technology and pattern finalized and are ready for the global stage. To move to the next level we require the capital to purchase all the components including fabrication, manufacturing and sourcing the aromatic herbs from the best fields available.

Acquiring Aroma Robes through this exclusive IndieGoGo deal will not only help us launch our product into the global market but allow you to save on an item that would normally retail at $390.

Aroma Robes transforms small moments of relaxation into mindful therapeutic sessions – bringing spa luxury to your home

Experience the mystique, relaxation and natural healing power of Aroma Robes!

story:
2013 - The Year of the GH0ST

In the Uniterd States, the production of most longboard wheels are controlled by only a handful of companies.  GH0ST aims to change that, and you can have a direct impact on this effort by helping to contribute to our first production run.  We're not interested in making another cookie-cutter wheel using the same old urethane and hubs.  We're out to change the game!

  • The first ever nested double-bearing longboard wheel. We've reinvented the wheel specifically for the needs of longboarders and street lugers.

  • Unprecedented speed and slide characteristics.  More than simply being a 'failsafe', the nested bearings will allow for higher top speeds by reducing overall rolling resistance and increasing the capacity for the wheels to carry momentum.  The slide characteristics will also be superior, allowing riders to break into slides effortlessly and 'hook up' out of slides predictably.  Since the wheels are centerset, you will get twice the use out of them, as they are reversible to prevent coning.

  • Be a part of the first ever crowdfund project to launch a new longboard/luge wheel company!
  • The first production run wheels geared toward freeriding will feature an 80A urethane in 72mm and 78mm sizes, centerset, 54mm contact patch, rounded lips.

The Goal

Making wheels is a very expensive process and this is why there have not been many people who have tried.  With the support of the longboard community, we hope to change this with a unique product that has no precedent.

Our goal to raise a total of $3200 will cover the costs for our business license, patent application, and most importantly, machining for the wheel molds and hubs, buying the off-the-shelf parts, and paying for the molding by a professional urethane company necessary to make the first production run of GH0ST Wheels.  Any additional funds we receive will go toward the second production run of GH0ST Wheels specifically for downhill racing, featuring a soft grippy urethane, a larger contact patch and square lips.

We have added different contribution levels for those who would like different levels of rewards.  This adds a bit of diversity so you can make a choice that works for your budget.  You can get:

  •  a GH0ST limited -run screen-printed T-shirt
  •  a set of 1st-production-run GH0ST Wheels
  •  the whole package:  T-shirt, sticker pack, and a set of 1st-production-run GH0ST Wheels!

We intent to mold the first few sets of test prototypes for testing before the full production run to ensure that the correct urethane has been chosen.  The testing results will be publicized here and on the GH0ST facebook page so you can view our progress.

The Impact

You can help us 'break the mold' of the 'same old, same old' by contributing to our campaign.  You can get an awesome set of wheels from the first production run, and you help our dream come true, helping to support a brand new company that is dedicated to pushing the envelope!

Our goal is to make the wheels with the best speed and slide characteristics on the market, hands-down.  These wheels will not be for everyone but it is our goal to make as many people as possible, more than happy with our results.

GH0ST Wheels have been designed by a mechanical designer with 7 years of industry experience in design, machining, moldmaking and manufacturing/production methods in general.  The GH0ST concept has been 3 years in the making - it's time to introduce the GH0ST to the world.

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everybody has the ability to contribute, but if you love where we're going, you can still help:

  • 'Like' and share our facebook page
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
story_txt:
2013 - The Year of the GH0ST
In the Uniterd States, the production of most longboard wheels are controlled by only a handful of companies.  GH0ST aims to change that, and you can have a direct impact on this effort by helping to contribute to our first production run.  We're not interested in making another cookie-cutter wheel using the same old urethane and hubs.  We're out to change the game!

The first ever nested double-bearing longboard wheel. We've reinvented the wheel specifically for the needs of longboarders and street lugers.

Unprecedented speed and slide characteristics.  More than simply being a 'failsafe', the nested bearings will allow for higher top speeds by reducing overall rolling resistance and increasing the capacity for the wheels to carry momentum.  The slide characteristics will also be superior, allowing riders to break into slides effortlessly and 'hook up' out of slides predictably.  Since the wheels are centerset, you will get twice the use out of them, as they are reversible to prevent coning.

Be a part of the first ever crowdfund project to launch a new longboard/luge wheel company!


The first production run wheels geared toward freeriding will feature an 80A urethane in 72mm and 78mm sizes, centerset, 54mm contact patch, rounded lips.




The Goal
Making wheels is a very expensive process and this is why there have not been many people who have tried.  With the support of the longboard community, we hope to change this with a unique product that has no precedent.
Our goal to raise a total of $3200 will cover the costs for our business license, patent application, and most importantly, machining for the wheel molds and hubs, buying the off-the-shelf parts, and paying for the molding by a professional urethane company necessary to make the first production run of GH0ST Wheels.  Any additional funds we receive will go toward the second production run of GH0ST Wheels specifically for downhill racing, featuring a soft grippy urethane, a larger contact patch and square lips.
We have added different contribution levels for those who would like different levels of rewards.  This adds a bit of diversity so you can make a choice that works for your budget.  You can get:

 a GH0ST limited -run screen-printed T-shirt
 a set of 1st-production-run GH0ST Wheels
 the whole package:  T-shirt, sticker pack, and a set of 1st-production-run GH0ST Wheels!

We intent to mold the first few sets of test prototypes for testing before the full production run to ensure that the correct urethane has been chosen.  The testing results will be publicized here and on the GH0ST facebook page so you can view our progress.


The Impact
You can help us 'break the mold' of the 'same old, same old' by contributing to our campaign.  You can get an awesome set of wheels from the first production run, and you help our dream come true, helping to support a brand new company that is dedicated to pushing the envelope!
Our goal is to make the wheels with the best speed and slide characteristics on the market, hands-down.  These wheels will not be for everyone but it is our goal to make as many people as possible, more than happy with our results.
GH0ST Wheels have been designed by a mechanical designer with 7 years of industry experience in design, machining, moldmaking and manufacturing/production methods in general.  The GH0ST concept has been 3 years in the making - it's time to introduce the GH0ST to the world.


Other Ways You Can Help
Not everybody has the ability to contribute, but if you love where we're going, you can still help:

'Like' and share our facebook page
Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
We are CIMINO Engineering Inc. A family operated business that has shifted from working primarily in structural engineering, to designing and engineering medical devices.

3MAX SUPPORT is our first medical device. It was dreamed and designed by Salvatore Cimino (head of the family and business) after he developed an ulcer on his foot and almost lost it to amputation. Salvatore Cimino has suffered from diabetes and its effects on the body for over 20 years.


  He designed this medical device after being told by his doctors that he needed to lay in bed for 6 months to relieve pressure off the ulcer. His only options for mobility were wheelchairs and crutches. Knowing that even with wheelchairs or crutches, his work capabilities would still be limited, so he designed 3MAX support with the intention of creating a device that would allow him to be mobile rather than be in bed the whole time all while the healing process was taking place. The device freed his hands and even allowed him to wear his own shoes.

  There is nothing like this on the market today. Most devices that relieve pressure require patients to not wear shoes and they are very obvious to the eyes of others. 

  3MAX Support works by RELIVING PRESSURE OFF THE WOUND, which is one of the requirements to allow faster healing.

  This product is very important not just for our family, but also for the amount of patients out there who currently suffer from ulcers of the foot and are limited by the lack of devices available in the market that fit their individual condition.

  As a family and as a business we have a set of goals that we would like to accomplish with this product. However, 3MAX support is just the START! We would like to have the opportunity to work closely with other patients who need orthopedic/medical devices so that we can develop them according to their needs. We would also like to create awareness about what DIABETES does to the body, and how it can greatly increase chances for amputation when a foot ulcer has developed.

  By helping us develop and launch this product, contributors will not only be contributing to 3MAX SUPPORT but they will also be aiding in the creation of other new devices.


  • A portion of funding we are asking for will go to developing the last prototypes and testing. 3MAX Support is a device composed in different parts, with different materials that need to be designed and built with precision in order to accommodate:

1. Severity of the ulcer.

2. Weight and foot size of patient (taking into account that some patients swell more than others).

3. The exterior conditions the device will be exposed to since it will be worn on outside of footwear.

  • The other portion will be used for the production of samples that will be sent to different doctors, organizations, and hospitals as part of our initial marketing plan. With these, we will need to invest in packaging, and labels and information to be sent out with initial product package.

  • We have created a set of perks according to the amount of donation. Any amount helps, and we want you to know all contributors will be part of 3MAX Support team. We have T-shirts, pens, key chains, and the opportunity to give a patient a medical device or receive one yourself. We are also willing to work with medical device retailers. And REMEMBER! We will be donating 5% to the American diabetes association as part of our goal to create awareness.

  • We have decided to make our funding flexible because we believe we can probably section our goals in different stages (prototype, testing, and initial marketing). If we didn’t reach our goal, we would work on just one stage according to the funds we have, and then try to collect the other funds for next stages. If this were to happen, we will inform everyone what our steps will be and how we will proceed as it would make the process slower. However, we are confident that with your help we will be able to make this happen.


  • We believe our medical device can be very useful and successful for patients. 3MAX Support would not just work for diabetic patients with ulcers but it can also help with conditions like METATARSALGIA, MORTON’S NEUROMA, CLAW FOOT, and RHEUMATOID FOOT.

  • 3MAX Support will allow many people to live a fairly normal life without making their injury worse. We want this device to have the same impact on patients as it did on our family. It saved one of us from a foot amputation, while removing some restrictions that other medical solutions can have (wheelchair, crutches, or bed rest).


IF YOU CAN’T CONTRIBUTE, THAT’S OK!

  • You can still be part of this by just spreading the word!
  • Talk to your family, friends and use social media to share this campaign!

But most of all thank you for taking the time to read this and making the decision to help others.

story:
Milan's Story

 

Milan Halikowski is a 12 year old transboy living in Prince George, BC who has dealt with such extreme homophobic and gendered violence, as well as bullying, that he was forced to leave school for the past year. His mother has been forced to leave work to care for him, adding to the financial hardship already exacerbated by Milan's ongoing medical and transition costs. There are no trans resources in Prince George, requiring the family to travel regularly to Vancouver.

This year, Milan and his mom Lynnell have the opportunity to attend Gender Odyssey Family, an annual conference for families who are working to navigate the day-to-day realities of raising a child who is gender non conforming or transgender (http://www.genderodysseyfamily.org/). This represents opportunities for Milan and Lynnell to access trans resources, meet new friends and make new contacts. The timing would allow them to travel through Vancouver on their way home, attending important medical appointments for Milan.

However,

 

The costs of transportation to Seattle, in addition to accommodations, transportation to Vancouver and accommodations during that stay are too much for this family under hardship to bear. Without financial help, Milan and Lynnell will be locked out of this trip and the invaluable resources that they have no way to access in Northern BC.

How You Can Help Milan:

Donating to Milan will allow him to travel to Gender Odyssey Family to meet other kids like him, learn about how to advocate for himself, and connect with the professionals that can help him throughout his transition and beyond. This trip is invaluable to the health of a little boy who just wants to be himself,  with a family and friends who have put all their resources into his welfare and just can't quite make this happen. But you can- donate to Milan's indiegogo campaign to help him reach for the resources he needs to keep him healthy and happy in mind and body.

Other Ways You Can Help

 

If you can't give money, spread the word by sharing Milan's campaign on Facebook, Twitter and any other social media. For more information, email Milan's advocates at teamgender@gmail.com.

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Hey everyone ! My name is Kaleb, I'm a 24 year old college student, foster parent, and husband to an amazing wife! 
For those of you that don't know, I am transgender. What this means is that I was born female but now identify as male. I have been on hormone replacement therapy for about four years and I am now seeking out "Top Surgery" which is the removal of breast tissue. I feel confident when people read me as male, and yet constantly question my legitimacy and how long it will be before others will find out I’m hiding breasts. I often fear the repercussions of this potential discovery, and crave a time when I won’t have to constrict my breathing and movement while wearing a binder (chest compressor)daily. I have found it emotionally difficult and physically painful to continue to hide my chest in order to feel confident in myself without fear of people questioning who I am.


What can I do?

Donating in any amount is very appreciated (Seriously - a dollar or five goes a long way to making a difference!), but getting the word out is just as important.
I'm trying to raise $2,900 and I would love to be able to meet that goal.  Can you take a minute to spread the word?

Donate a few dollars
Tweet it
Facebook it
Email your friends
Send some positive thoughts


Where is the money going? 

Your contributions will help cover the cost of Top Surgery. The goal is $2,900. Any funds raised in addition to the $2,900 will help to cover the final costs.

story:
Why Bubble Soccer?

The answer is simple.  F-U-N.

Burlington is a vibrant playground for creative, active people who like to have fun.  I've lived, worked, and played in Burlington for over 10 years and have been constantly surprised by the level of community support and involvement shown by my neighbors.  Whether it be for education, sports, the arts, or non-profit endeavors the people of Vermont show up and pitch in to make this an interesting and healthy place to grow.

There's an element of play in the air here, and that's why this is a perfect place for PLAY Bubble Soccer and the Burlington Bubbleball League.  I'm sure some of you have seen the "viral" videos of Bubble Soccer games held in Europe over the past year (if not, check out the attached video).  This looks incredibly fun!  It seems that this phenomenon has crossed the Atlantic, and leagues are popping up across the country.  I think it's time we have our own, don't you?! 

For information about the Burlington Bubbleball League and the rules of bubble soccer please visit PlayBubbleSoccer.com

What We Need & What You Get

To help this dream become a reality it would be great to feel some love from the community. The bubbles aren't cheap, are shipping from a LONG way away, and having some financial support from the community on the front end will help make the costs more manageable for me.  The goal is set at $3,500 which will cover a portion of the cost of the bubbles, shipping from mainland China to Boston/ground transport to Burlington, and a deposit for renting appropriate facilities for the 8-week league and "Bubble Bowl" playoffs. To say thank-you, our packages offer HUGE DISCOUNTS and GREAT REWARDS!!!

There are 9 packages available:

1. BITE-SIZED Bubble - $1  Gets you:
  • I will shout your praises to the skies while the moon is full!

2. BUSKER Bubble - $5  Gets you:

  • I will compose a short song about you (in the genre of your choosing) and email you an mp3!

3. BABY Bubble - $15  Gets you:

  • Use of a soccer bubble for TWO 1-hour open-play sessions!

4. BEGINNER Bubble - $30  Gets you:

  • Use of a soccer bubble for THREE 1-hour open-play sessions!!
  • League T-Shirt

5. BASIC Bubble - $60  Gets you:

  • Use of a soccer bubble for for league games and open-play days!
  • 1 membership in a league team (You can register for a house team or combine with friends to form your own team)
  • 50% discount from regular league fees FOR 2 YEARS ($60 fee instead of $120)
  • League T-Shirt

6. BOOGIE BUBBLE -BEST VALUE- $175 Gets you:

  • YOUR OWN BUBBLE!!!
  • 1 membership in a league team (You can register for a house team or combine with friends to form your own team)
  • 50% discount from regular league fees FOR 2 YEARS ($60 fee instead of $120)
  • League T-Shirt

7. BLENDER BUBBLE - $300  Gets you:

  • 1 full team membership in the league (6-7 players)
  • Use of 6-7 soccer bubbles for league games and open-play days!
  • Secures you a $400 team membership price FOR 2 YEARS ($440 savings)
  • League T-Shirts for your team
  • A non-profit organization of your choosing will be donated a FREE bubble soccer fundraising event
  • A special Thank-You to you or your business on our website (without logo)

8. BUSINESS BUBBLE - $1,500  Gets you:

  • YOUR OWN SOCCER BUBBLE!!!
  • YOUR LOGO ON LEAGUE T-SHIRTS!!!
  • Use of 6-7 soccer bubbles for league games and open-play days!
  • 4 full TEAM memberships in the league (6-7 players)
  • Secures you a $400 team membership price FOR 2 YEARS ($440 savings)
  • League T-Shirts for your teams
  • A non-profit organization of your choosing will be donated a FREE bubble soccer fundraising event
  • A corporate/private bubble soccer event
  • 3' x 8' color logo banner displayed at all league games for 1 year
  • Logo displayed prominently on PlayBubbleSoccer.com for 1 year

9. BALLER BUBBLE - $5,000  Gets you:

  • 7 OF YOUR OWN SOCCER BUBBLES!!!
  • YOUR LOGO ON ALL LEAGUE SOCCER BUBBLES AND T-SHIRTS!!!
  • 4 full TEAM memberships in the league (6-7 players)
  • Secures you a $400 team membership price FOR LIFE
  • League T-Shirts for your teams
  • A non-profit organization of your choosing will be donated a FREE bubble soccer fundraising event
  • A corporate/private bubble soccer event
  • 3' x 8' color logo banner displayed at all league games for 1 year
  • Logo displayed prominently on PlayBubbleSoccer.com for 1 year

The Result?

YOU helped make Burlington more fun!  YOU get to have a lot of fun!  YOU helped build a small business in Vermont!

Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe you can’t contribute financially, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Tell your friends!
  • Share our links!
  • Like our pages!
  • Keep making Burlington an awesome place to live!
  • THANK YOU!!!

story:
What’s up?

I’m a trans man, which means that I was assigned a different gender at birth than I identify with. Because of this, there are some things with my body that don’t look the way they’re supposed to. The biggest of these is my chest. Every time I look in the mirror, I do not see the man I am becoming; instead, I see a girl and a betrayal. My body is not the way it should be.

What does that mean?

Well, aside from being profoundly depressing (which it is) and causing me to look at my body as a prison instead of a shrine (which it does), there are also physical side effects. In order to minimize the look of my chest, I have been binding – or compressing my chest with heavy-duty binders – daily for over four years. In the day-to-day, this means that I have trouble breathing and engaging in strenuous activities, and I also deal with ongoing bodily pain and indigestion as a result. Over the long term, binding can lead to breakdown of the breast tissue, which can put a person at higher risk for certain medical conditions.

I know it sounds kind of crazy to undergo that kind of pain on a daily basis, but for me it’s a lesser of two evils. Physical pain is better than the mental distress I have any time someone calls me ma’am or I catch a glimpse of myself in a mirror.

How does this get fixed?

In order to feel at home in my body, I need to have top surgery. Top surgery is a tissue reduction and reforming procedure which removes the majority of the breast tissue and shapes the chest to a more masculine appearance. Unfortunately, it is also very expensive at around $10,000.

Like many people, I am uninsured (although most insurance plans do not currently cover sexual reassignment surgeries), and live on a tight budget. I am saving money and considering loans to help me pay for this medically necessary procedure, but it’s still a hefty chunk of change. As such, I am doing something which is very hard for me – asking for help to defray the cost of this surgery.

Can you help? No amount is too small (or too large!) and I am thankful for any help you can give.

What can I do?

Thanks for asking!  Donating in any amount is very appreciated (Seriously - a dollar or five goes a long way to making a difference!), but getting the word out is just as important.

I'm trying to raise about half the cost of top surgery - $5,000 - and I would love to be able to meet and exceed that goal.  Can you take a minute to spread the word?

  • Donate a few dollars
  • Tweet it
  • Facebook it
  • Email your friends
  • Send some positive thoughts
  • Have a house party and put out a donation hat
  • Write a song, put it up on Youtube, and let people know! 

Anything you can do is very appreciated.  Thank you for helping me get this off my chest!
story_txt:
What’s up? 
I’m a trans man, which means that I was assigned a different gender at birth than I identify with. Because of this, there are some things with my body that don’t look the way they’re supposed to. The biggest of these is my chest. Every time I look in the mirror, I do not see the man I am becoming; instead, I see a girl and a betrayal. My body is not the way it should be.
What does that mean? 
Well, aside from being profoundly depressing (which it is) and causing me to look at my body as a prison instead of a shrine (which it does), there are also physical side effects. In order to minimize the look of my chest, I have been binding – or compressing my chest with heavy-duty binders – daily for over four years. In the day-to-day, this means that I have trouble breathing and engaging in strenuous activities, and I also deal with ongoing bodily pain and indigestion as a result. Over the long term, binding can lead to breakdown of the breast tissue, which can put a person at higher risk for certain medical conditions.
I know it sounds kind of crazy to undergo that kind of pain on a daily basis, but for me it’s a lesser of two evils. Physical pain is better than the mental distress I have any time someone calls me ma’am or I catch a glimpse of myself in a mirror.
How does this get fixed? 
In order to feel at home in my body, I need to have top surgery. Top surgery is a tissue reduction and reforming procedure which removes the majority of the breast tissue and shapes the chest to a more masculine appearance. Unfortunately, it is also very expensive at around $10,000.
Like many people, I am uninsured (although most insurance plans do not currently cover sexual reassignment surgeries), and live on a tight budget. I am saving money and considering loans to help me pay for this medically necessary procedure, but it’s still a hefty chunk of change. As such, I am doing something which is very hard for me – asking for help to defray the cost of this surgery.
Can you help? No amount is too small (or too large!) and I am thankful for any help you can give.
What can I do?
Thanks for asking!  Donating in any amount is very appreciated (Seriously - a dollar or five goes a long way to making a difference!), but getting the word out is just as important.
I'm trying to raise about half the cost of top surgery - $5,000 - and I would love to be able to meet and exceed that goal.  Can you take a minute to spread the word?

Donate a few dollars
Tweet it
Facebook it
Email your friends
Send some positive thoughts
Have a house party and put out a donation hat
Write a song, put it up on Youtube, and let people know! 
Anything you can do is very appreciated.  Thank you for helping me get this off my chest!

story:
The Quest and the Vision...

Hello friends and family alike!

My journey "back to the land" continues to blossom and has guided me to health and abundance mainly through one thing--PLANTS!  In a world plagued with pharmaceutical "solutions" and addictions, I am always striving to find alternative options for my own health and for the education of others.  In April, I am embarking upon a four-month intensive program with a medicinal herb school in northern California--there, I will be studying plants from the perspective of our Native American ancestors.  For me, this means finally settling into a passionate life-long trade of healing with the support and intention from YOU!

The Investment...

I need to raise $2,000 to complete my tuition payment and to provide myself with lodging for the four months I am in school.  When I discovered that three jobs wasn't going to cut it, I thought I would reach out to my amazing community of friends and family.  Anything helps, even if I can't reach the ultimate goal!  (20 people at $100 or 100 people at $20 or $2,000 people at $1!)

I want everyone to feel like YOU are a part of this incredible vision with me, so I look forward to giving back in any way that I can!  Even if that just means that you have a solid herbalist reference in your life--I am so happy to support your path to herbal healing!

The Impact...

As I deepen my heart song, I know that it becomes more and more important that all of us re-connect with the land and the healing modalities it has to share with us.  Through education and practice, I wish to heal the people and the land through natural botanical wisdom!   

If your finances are as tight as mine, please help me to pass the word along!  

Blessings!

story:
Hi there!

We are Los Angeles based Aerial Artists Brett Womack and Rachel Bowman. As the duo Womack and Bowman we perform regularly throughout LA at special events, celebrity parties, for film and television shows as well as for various tours with different Circus Companies. Our primary Aerial apparatus are the Silks but we also perform on Aerial rope, Trapeze, Straps, Lyra (hoop) and Hammock. As well as perform we also teach at various studios in LA and at a number of circus and dance facilities around the world.

                                                  

                       

                                


We have been professional Aerialists for the past twelve years and collectively have spent more then 25,000 hours rehearsing and training on various Aerial apparatus. Thats 25,000 hours spent in work out clothes! Having no ‘Aerial Clothing’  available for us to purchase, we would buy training clothing from dance stores and sports stores or regular clothing stores. The clothing we have purchased and worn ranges from leggings to sweat-pants to ballet leotards to sports bras to tank tops and so on. Even after twelve years, we still struggle with wardrobe malfunctions (tanks getting caught in the Fabric) and the dreaded ‘Fabric burns’ that happen if our skin is not covered. Leggings and tank tops, the staple attire of most Yoga or Pilates students don’t work for Aerial because as we invert (we do that a lot) the tank top rides up revealing the belly, we then wrap the fabric around said belly, roll or flip into a pose and BURN our skin painfully because the tank top did not provide adequate coverage! Shorts and sports bra's, the uniform of the runner, are also not appropriate for us, we need coverage on our legs and torso. Sweat pants are too baggy and get caught in the fabric during tricks, Ballet leotards protect from burns but adding layers (and lets face it, whose gonna wear a leotard without adding a tank or leggings?) give the dreaded ‘double bum’ look that comes with adding tights and the tank makes it super difficult and inconvenient to go to the restroom! (25,000 hours people!!) After a particularly nasty burn to her stomach last October while training with Brett, Rachel jumped off the Fabric (landing safely on a matt of course!) in exasperation and let Brett have it “I’m sick of this CRAP” (she may have used a different word) why has no one invented a Unitard for training so that we don’t have to deal with this?” Brett, in his usual pragmatic way responded “Rachel, there are plenty of Unitards out there, you just don’t like to wear them because they aren’t convenient or fashionable enough for your liking.” Rachel begrudgingly acknowledged that he was right. “You know, i would wear a Unitard if i could leave it hanging down, if it looked like a cute skirt when i wasn’t using it for training, then i could just pull it up over my regular bra when i wanted coverage” “hmmm” replied Brett “Perhaps there is something here?” And so the idea for the BurnFree work out Onesie for Aerialists was born.


                                    

                                    Ouch! Rachel's fabric burn that began it all...

We have teamed up with the phenomenally talented clothing designer Lori Lee Gordon, who also designs all of our performance costumes, to create the BurnFree Onesie. The goal is to create an all-in-one Unitard for female Aerialists and Aerial students (we plan to develop a male version soon boys!) that is durable, functional, dual-purpose and fashionable. Worn on the street it is a cute skirt, attached to a pair of leggings. Pull it up and it becomes a body hugging Unitard that protects the skin from Fabric burns. When worn as a skirt, the shoulder straps of the unitard fasten at the waist and look like part of the skirt. Go for coffee, run errands and no one will look at you strangely for having your underwear hanging out of your pants as often happens with the Ballet leotards or regular Unitards. 

                           

                            From unitard to skirt in just a few seconds!


In keeping with our commitment to innovation and multi-function products and to do our part for environmental protection, we plan to package the BurnFree Workout Onesie in a highly original and completely sustainable way. By collecting USED Aerial Fabrics (when they eventually tear and become more ‘Holy then righteous’ the Fabrics are no longer workable) and cutting them into strips, they will then be turned into small draw-string bags which is what the Onesie will be packaged in. The Aerial Fabric bag is then available for the customers personal use, perhaps for their resin sock or spray, water bottle, Dramamine (just kidding!) or other aerial related tools!

In the future, we plan to have a variety of work out clothing and performance options for the professional and amateur Aerialist but right now we are concentrating on the creation of a single product. With your help we can create, market, package and sell the worlds first Aerial training Onesie thus enhancing the lives of Aerialists all over the world! Think of the tender skins that can be saved! Think of the near strangulations that can be avoided (try hanging from your tank top twenty feet in the air) Think of the self-esteem that can be boosted (no more embarrassed Aerialists at the local Starbucks with their leotard straps hanging down to their knees!). The Aerial community is in desperate need of the BurnFree Onesie! Whether you are a budding Aerialist yourself or you have an interest in Aerial fitness or Aerial yoga classes, or perhaps you just appreciate a good Aerial performance in a Cirque Du Soleil show, contributing to this campaign in any way shape or form will have a positive impact on this wonderful community! 

We have a goal of raising $5000 with our Indiegogo campaign. This money will go towards the ongoing costs of labor, manufacturing, production, marketing and distribution costs as well assist us in obtaining the neccessarry business licenses and permits needed to legally start our business.  Obviously we are aware it will cost us more then $5000 to really launch the BurnFree Aerial workout Onesie but this amount will ensure that we are off to an excellent start! 

If we don’t reach our entire $5000 goal with this campaign we will use the funds that we do raise to continue the research and development phase of the business. Creating a product that we are incredibly proud of and that we can truly stand behind is our primary purpose.

Perks! Did we tell you we had perks!? Contributing to our campaign does not just mean you are an awesome person who cares about the safety of the Aerial community at large but you also get FREE STUFF!! Our perks include custom designed Thank You cards, T-shirts, Aerial Silks workshop passes as well as private lessons! For contributions over $600 we are also including a Womack and Bowman Adagio performance (for your party, event, wedding etc, you chose the date!) valued at $1600. For contributions over $1000 we are also adding a Womack and Bowman Aerial performance valued at $2,500 INCLUDING a temporary outdoor rig that we will personally bring to your house/event site, which we will then perform on and dismantle! Yup! your own custom designed, personalized Aerial performance! 


          

               We will perform at your party and entertain you guests!!!!! Woohoo!!

With that being said we really do appreciate any contribution you can make, big or small. If it can’t be financial, just sharing this campaign would help us out immensely as would the donation of your used Aerial Fabrics that we can then turn into bags for packaging. Our goal is to create a completely unique item of clothing that is specific to the needs and desires of the hard working Aerialist. We love our students and our community and believe that we all deserve to feel safe and special and have an item of clothing designed specifically for what we do on a daily or weekly bases. Thank you so much for your support and we look forward to connecting with you soon!


                          

Much thanks,

                    Brett and Rachel 

         AKA Womack and Bowman :)

story:
Hi!

I'm one of a very small group of dedicated occupational and speech therapists in Trinidad and Tobago. We've decided to run Team Hope to raise much-needed funds to support the Trinidad and Tobago Occupational Therapy Association (TTOTA), as well as the Speech-Language Audiology Association of Trinidad and Tobago (SLAAT).

Team Hope has been successfully run twice before - in 2008/2009, and again in 2010/2011. The video above was created during Team Hope 2010/2011.

Team Hope is about "helping ordinary people do extraordinary things". A group of ordinary people like have embarked upon a seven-month journey with an extraordinary goal in mind - raise funds for two invaluable professions, and participate in the Rainbow Cup Triathlon in Tobago in JUne 2013. Each athlete is paired with an "honoured teammate", in whose honour they will complete the triathlon. These honoured teammates represent the individuals who receive or have received occupational and/or speech therapy in the country.

Each athlete has pledged to raise $4000TT for Team Hope, which will go to the Associations. As one of the occupational therapists, I can tell you that 40% of the funds raised will go towards Education and Development, 30% for Public Awareness Campaign, and the remaining 30% goes towards a Bursary Fund.

Please support me as I continue in my journey towards helping others, promoting health, and becoming fitter!

Please share this campaign as well so that others can recognise the work being done in Trinidad and Tobago, and raise awareness of these professions!

Thank you!!!

story:
I help Dr. Komelski of Virginia Tech teach his taiji/qigong curriculum in the New River Valley. It is our goal to make the health benefits and pleasure of taiji available to everyone in the area; and to build a community of taiji practitioners that nurture each other's development.

The money I raise will pay for my tuition at a taiji teacher certification program. I have completed one part of the training program already. This second part of intensive training will further refine my understanding and practice of taiji and eventually lead to my teacher certification in taiji. Once certified I will be better able to help Dr. Komelski establish and refine programming in our classes.

Dr. Yang Yang's Evidence-Based Training (EBT) is a nationally and internationally recognized certification program that combines the 30 years of Dr. Yang's taiji teaching experience and his taiji research. The EBT program has been show to increase lower body strength, force control, functional balance, vestibular function, immunce function, and complex holistic benefits combining physical, mental, emotional, social and spiritual dimensions. (See attached summary of academic findings for further details.)

My EBT experience was great. I met lots of aspiring professionals. And my time with Dr. Yang was very helpful.

 
I have been helping Dr. Komelski teach taiji/qigong now for two years. I am grateful for the learning experience and the opportunity to pass the knowledge on to other people. Besides helping teach his regular classes I have also taken it on myself to hold a free community class so that everyone in the community may have an opportunity to learn the practice. I hope to continue to build practice communities and friendships through sharing this knowledge.

story:
With SW@P, you'll visualize the world in a whole new way!

Calling all media-philes, photographers, and videographers! We have created a smartphone app that will allow publishers of the undiscovered to easily create digital galleries of their masterpieces. Unlike regular stock photo sites -- however -- our images are curated to ensure no fluff or spam. 

Capabilities

These galleries will be easily accessed by users who can then purchase the image with full use of rights -- in exchange the publisher receives full compensation.

Basically what this app allows is for anyone with a smartphone to become a professional photographer / videographer on the side. As long as your content is dope enough for people to want to buy, you can make a nice side income.

If your established in the space and you want a more agile way to get your stuff out there then this is the app for you!

We also publish daily content that related to scientific exploration, adventure travel, environmental research, and outer space investigations by first rate journalist Reilly Capps.

 

Why we decided to indiegogo?

Right now the app only works on droids. We want to raise money in order to successfully port the application to both iOS and Windows Phone 8. We also want all of the people who donate to become beta testers. This way you can help provide further hands on experience and give us valuable feedback so that we may make this a pleasure to use on both publisher and user end.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Send me an email if you're interested in beta testing and we'll add you to a list for when we open up a second round :). Please signup through our website here: http://www.riledupjournal.com/

We also publish daily content that related to scientific exploration, adventure travel, environmental research, and outer space investigations by first rate journalist Reilly Capps.

Right now the app only works on droids. We want to raise money in order to successfully port the application to both iOS and Windows Phone 8. We also want all of the people who donate to become beta testers. This way you can help provide further hands on experience and give us valuable feedback so that we may make this a pleasure to use on both publisher and user end.


Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!
Send me an email if you're interested in beta testing and we'll add you to a list for when we open up a second round :). Please signup through our website here: http://www.riledupjournal.com/

story:
Improve Your Game ... Instantly


                                             


 

                                            Courtesy of GolfBallPix.com


Selecting the right golf ball can make a major difference in a player's game, confidence and enjoyment of the game. Unfortunately, golfers are barraged with performance claims from manufacturers, marketing gimmicks and a complex maze of pricing and performance challenges in finding - and buying the right ball - that provides maximum value and a real difference for the player.

                                     

We conceived and built the GolfBallSelector.com Online Fitting System based on our patent-awarded and patent-pending golf ball evaluation and fitting technology - with the objective of Helping Golfers Become Better Golfers!

GolfBallSelector.com has been heralded as one of the top innovations in golf by Golf Magazine and other leading media - and is supported by rigorous and independent testing and data collection and processing by GolfBallTest.org. To date, we have robot, field and bench tested more than 200 leading golf balls, and provide regular updates when new balls are introduced to the market.

GolfBallSelector.com is entirely member supported - and we are entirely vendor-neutral and agnostic in our recommendations of the best golf ball for an individual golfer.    

We believe golfers, everywhere - regardless of their age, gender, experience level, should achieve the best performance possible in their game - and to trust and believe in their equipment - and their equipment choices.  The more we can raise, the more we can extend our independent golf ball testing programs - and the more golfers we can reach throughout the world - and involve them directly in soliciting their reviews and opinions on golf balls and golf equipment.  More testing, more data analysis - and the build out of independent rating tools and systems, such as TheRealList -- that we launched in the Summer of 2012 - will move us all further establishing the new consumer-centric platform for choosing the right golf ball: GolfBallAdvisor.com.

                                     


What We Need & What You Get

Our stretch goal for Crowd Funding the further build out GolfBallSelector.com is $150,000 and our first raise here is for $45,000.

With the proceeds from this initial fund raise, we will apply and combine funds to acquire and set up a new robotic testing facility and create new jobs, through our testing and data analysis.

Proceeds will then be used to build out the premier golf ball performance rating system - and to independently certify golf balls based on different types of performance, such as distance, control/spin, feel and value-for-money. 

 

 

If we don't reach our entire goal, the funding will be used to incrementally further the testing and global marketing of the GolfBallSelector system - to keep it independent and not reliant upon advertisements.  The funds that are raised will be used to pay staff and consultant salaries and keep the dream alive and flourishing!


The Impact

We have been involved in the golf equipment evaluation and custom club fitting for more than a decade - and have pioneered innovative approaches to help golfers improve their confidence and enjoy their games.

Confidence Builds Trust - and Confidence Drives Performance.  

Our mission is to help golfers and consumers:  Believe | Trust | Achieve.  

                                  

 

Your contributions will help us achieve this goal.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Help us get the word out!

Tell your friends - share our campaign with Indiegogo tools - and chat us up on Twitter, Instagram and Facebook!

                                              

Buy Premium Recycled Golf Balls - available as an option upon completing the GolfBallSelector.com system. This will let you - save money | and help save the environment. It is estimated that more than 500 million golf balls are lost each year - mainly in ponds, that are later fished out and resold.  Most of these golf balls perform "good as new" - validated by our independent performance evaluation and benchmarking, and documented in our White Paper. We firmly believe that playing Premium Recycled Golf Balls is a great way to save some money and help the planet.

story:
FRESNO, California, USA (May 6, 2013)–Sikh24 has learned that an elderly Sikh man from Fresno, CA became the target of a hate crime outside Gurdwara Nanaksar, Cherry Road. Bhai Piara Singh is a volunteer at the Gurdwara and performs daily chores there.

The incident took place just outside the premises of Gurdwara Nanaksar when Piara Singh was walking towards his house after performing some morning duties.

The attack is being investigated as a hate crime. As per received reports, Piara Singh was beaten with a steel rod. He is currently admitted in the hospital undergoing treatment for severe head injuries, and his condition is said to be critical. His rib was also fractured and a lung collapsed during the attack.

We have learned that the suspect has already been arrested by the Fresno police.

Fresno is located in the heart of the Central Valley of California and has a sizable Sikh/Punjabi population. Although such vicious attacks are rare, they have continued to disturb the community living there. Not too long ago, a ‘parcharik’, or preacher, was attacked at Fresno’s International Airport next to the TSA office.

Post 9/11, Sikhs in the Central Valley have been victimized by hate crimes – even Sikh children are bullied at school about their appearance and values (Sikh24).

 

Help us help this man to a quick recovery. He is in critical condition. The victims wounds may never heal to 100%. Us a a community can do our best by raising money and helping Mr Singh receive the best healthcare and rehab possible. Thank you all.

story:
Hey guys! 

As some of you may or may not know Tuesday January 28th, 2014 I was in an accident on my way home from work. I was driving my scooter (also known as a moped) - it was starting to rain and a car stopped abruptly. I'm not sure how it happened/what happened exactly but after slamming on my breaks I remember blood everywhere as I had a huge laceration in my forehead all the way to the skull. This required a ride to the local hospital in an ambulance, the attention of a plastic surgeon, an MRI, 3 X-rays of my thigh/knee and 7 hours in the emergency room. (Thanks to above, I did not have a concussion, broken bones, whiplash or anything other than two lacerations and bruises on my left thigh!) 

I DO have insurance (thank the lord) - but my deductible in $2000.00 and from there my insurance only covers 50%. (yes, I am grateful for that 50% but fearful of the other 50%). 

My goal is merely to cover my deductible: $2000.00 but would love to fundraise enough money to pay the bill in full.  (Family/Friends are estimating a bill close to $5000 - and I think they're being nice with that estimate... not necessarily realistic)

With student loans, rent, utilities and employment with a non-profit center teaching pre-school you could imagine the financial stress I am anticipating. 

In return for donations I am going to give back to my community - in a "pay it forward" attempt. For every $150 donated I will donate 1 hour of my time to a local homeless community, and for every $75 donation I will donate 1 hour of my time to the organization of the donors choice, in my area.

I thank you in advance not only for your donation but for sharing my page with your friends/Facebook community. Thank you to those I know personally and those whom are friends of my friends. I appreciate all you can do :)

Take care. Be safe & Wear a helmet!

-Kendra Dowen

story:
Short Summary

Bon Voyage Supplements is a dream came true for travelers: Arrive Fresh, Happy and Energized wherever you go!
 
After a severe JetLag Experience (12 hours difference) on a business trip from Toronto to Beijing, back in 2011, Bon Voyage Supplements was born with on goal in mind: Help travelers regain their day while helping them have better sleep. We soon embarked on a 2 years journey to develop the world's most disruptive natural JetLag Supplement. After endless scientific literature research, internal trials and exclusive R&D partnership with Advanced Nutragenomics LLC, we have designed the world's first 2in1 Travel/JetLag Supplements. 
 
The formula has been developed around a clinically proven ingredient: Neuravena that boots cognitive functions, alterness and nuture the body. Our unique supplement is composed of DayTime and NightTime tablets
 
Because we are 100% transparent, we have made our formula white paper and product scientification document available for everyone - Feel free to download it following those links:
Bon Voyage White Paper
Bon Voyage Product Scientification
 
 

Bon Voyage exclusively uses Neuravena® (EFLA®955) as part of its scientifically-tested formula. Neuravena® is a brand of bioactivity tested, patented wild green oat extract, scientifically proven to enhance overall mental fitness and support cognitive performance, especially in stressful situations such as when travelling under jetlag.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

tO add more excitment to this amazing referral program, we want to reward the TOP 5 referrer with amazing prizes:

1st Prize: 1 Applewatch (Minimum total referees spend to qualify: 1,000$ or 50 referrals)

2nd Prize: 1 GoPro Hero 4 (Minimum total referees spend to qualify: 800$ or 40 referrals)

3rd Prize: 1 FitBit (Minimum total referees spend to qualify: 600$ or 30 referrals)

4th Prize: 1 Blade Nano Quadcopter (Minimum total referees spend to qualify: 400$ or 20 referrals)

5th Prize: 1 BluePhonic Wireless Sport Headphones (Minimum total referees spend to qualify: 200$ or 10 referrals)

Once you have referred your friends and/or family, send us your list of referees.

The list of winners will be published on the Updates section of our crowdfunding page, right after the completion of this campaign in October.

story:
my story

it all started with both remarkable grandmothers of mine. my dad's mom (bubbie) a holocaust survivor, created the most amazing recipes, without knowing how to read and write. sadly, I never had the option to inherit her recipes as she only created masterpieces from her memory.

my mom's mom (grandma margo) whom I was named after, has left numerous and delicious recipes for us to pass on for many generations to come.

with such lovely role models to look up to, I really thought about what I wanted to do with my life. what can I do to put a smile on other people's faces? what is something that everyone enjoys? BAKED GOODIES!

my mother, having a huge impact on my life, has worked in a newborn nursery as long as I have been alive. as much as I enjoy baking, I also wanted to incorporate the healthier side of baking into mine (& others) lives.

most baked products on the market today are delicious, but don't necessarily provide you with all of the basic nutrients your body needs to function. my goal is to show others that you can easily enjoy a baked goodie just as much, and have it be just as delicious. & HEALTHY! :)

a degree in baking, advice from some super motivational individuals, and finally - recipe perfection, I decided, I wanted to create my own product.

so here you have it folks, a healthy cookie aimed to help production of milk for pregnant mothers and their bosoms throughout breastfeeding.

what mom's noms is all about

mom's noms is on a mission to help new moms increase their milk supply! these wholesome & delicious cookies; not only a healthy way to satisfy your sweet tooth during your pregnancy, but the beneficial ingredients will help your bosoms produce milk for your newborn!

these cookies are bound to provide you with plenty of fiber, iron, & an abundance of healthy vitamins, minerals, and antioxidants. mom's noms goal is to bake a natural treat with a ton of nutrients for you and your baby. straight from the oven, right to your tummy. breastfeeding is challenging! you deserve nurturing during this time-period too.

mom's noms will make your taste buds tingle, your tummy smile, and most importantly they will help increase your milk supply in a healthy & natural way! your baby will smile too.

& even if you're not eating for two, you can enjoy these cookies just as much, and not lactate :)

these delightful cookies are:
100% organic
dairy free
gluten free
vegan

oh and did I mention the most important factor of all? these cookies are bound to be BIKE DELIVERED! what is better than a bike delivered baked good?

the impact

to get this project on a roll, I need your help to reach my goal!

as for progress and the current need for funding, I have been working endlessly on business plans, networking within the community, working out farmer's market details, food costs, and perfecting recipes. I have reached a point where mom's noms needs some exploratory funds for plans and licenses in order to get the ball rolling!

other ways you can help

spread the word! social networking! play telephone with your buds! if you have a friend who is expecting, feel free to send them in mom's noms direction.
 
thank you so much for your help!
 
http://www.facebook.com/momsnoms

story:
Hey I'm Tyler :D

I'm an Female to male transgender looking to get enough people to donate in order for me to help me with my savings for my top surgery (double mastectomy). 
So far I have £3500 saved from working solid over the summer whilst I'm back from University, and just need a further £2500 to go. 
I'm asking for people to sponsor me as I'm doing an indoor triathlon event and an indoor wall climb to get there. 
I am going to look for jobs as soon as I'm back at uni but it's incredibly difficult to get one as a student...I've been trying for the past two years and had no luck.

The Impact:

In all honesty the impact this would have on me cannot be described with words alone. It will be life-altering. I'll be able to wake up every day feeling happy instead of fighting off the depression that's been worsening over time. That's all I can say really...I'm pretty bad with knowing how to write things down from my head :L

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everybody can afford to donate to such things and that's absolutely fine. All I ask is that if everyone (those that can donate and those that can't) could please share this page or at least the YouTube video across social media to get as many people aware as possible. This could potentially help people like myself in the future when they're in a similar position.


Thank You All!!!! :)

story:
IT'S NOT TO LATE TO SHOW YOUR SUPPORT. MAKE A CONTRIBUTION TO OUR Push Pull Cardio Campaign.


I am Alan Ashley, the guy behind Push Pull Cardio. Being an Air Force veteran and a father of three, I am well-versed in dealing with challenges and overcoming barriers to success. In 2012, I was faced with two of the most difficult situations someone could face. My older brother fell into a coma that nearly claimed his life and weeks later I lost my oldest daughter to cancer. Both of these situations changed me forever.  I wanted to be a part of something bigger than myself and to help others in their pursuit of healthier lifestyles. 

My Education and Certifications:

  • Masters in Business Administration
  • American Council on Exercise - Certified Personal Trainer
  • American Heart Association - CPR/AED

Serving the Community

PPC conducts outdoor group fitness classes every Saturday and Sunday starting 8AM. Our classes provide a intense yet fun workout that helps each member get a few steps closer towards reaching their goals. Your help will help us expand this program, allowing us to move indoors and offer classes several times EVERY DAY. This is important because your contributions will give families in the community a low cost solution to receive training by a certified trainer.

What We Need

With your support, we are raising the $30,000 needed to fully fund our first fitness studio. With that we will be able to obtain a building along with the purchasing of all equipment needed. 100% of your contribution will go to pay for the studio.

Equipment Needs

TRX Mounting System, TRX Suspension Trainers, Rubber Flooring

Other Specialized Equipment (Not All Shown Here)

What You Get

You will be helping children and families around the world as we donate a portion of our profits to organizations which fight life-threatening diseases (more below).

We didn't forget about you either!  :) All contributions are welcome!

  • $1 - Thank You - Any amount helps. A heartfelt thanks for helping make Push Pull Cardio a reality!!
  • $10 - Supporter - All of the above + Facebook and website shout out as a supporter of Push Pull Cardio.
  • $15 - Silver Supporter - All of the above + Push Pull Cardio Wristband
  • $25 - Friend - All of the above + personalized thank you letter.
  • $50 - Endorser - All of the above + limited edition Push Pull Cardio sackpack.
  • $100 - Sponsor (Old) - All of the above + limited edition Push Pull Cardio T-Shirt.
  • $250 - Sponsor (New) - All of the above + limited edition Push Pull Cardio Sweater.
  • $1000 - Patron -All of the above + suspension training system with customize workout. + Name engraved on Founder's Plague.
  • $2500 - Champion- All of the above + workout created and named in your honor. Workout will be done each year the month of our anniversary. + Name engraved on Founder's Plaque.

Women's Push Pull Cardio Limited Edition T-Shirt Mock-up

 

Men's Push Pull Cardio Limited Edition T-Shirt Mock-up

At PPC, not only do we have a mission of creating healthy lifestyles, we are also in the fight to cure life-threatening diseases in children. Being a parent and having endured the loss of a child to cancer, I know firsthand the impact childhood disease has on the whole family. When I lost my daughter, the amount of support we received was incredible. PPC wants to help other families going through similar situations before they have to experience the loss of their child.

What Does This Really Mean?

Your contributions would help on two fronts.  First, did you know The United States is one of the world's most overweight nations with over 31% of adults being obese?  With your help we can make an impact on a community by providing an affordable solution.

Second, with 20% of PPC's profits being donated to charities assisting in the prevention of childhood diseases, the true impact of your contributions will be multiplied and felt by families around the world for years to come.

Other Ways You Can Help

Help me get the word out and make some noise about our project by sharing and reposting on Facebook, Twitter, Google+, Instagram and other forums.

Please use the Indiegogo share tools, as this will help this project gain exposure and get it listed on the front pages of Indiegogo.

Again, please spread the word and tell ALL your friends. You'll help make the world a healthier place to live in. Thank you!
