IT'S NOT TO LATE TO SHOW YOUR SUPPORT. MAKE A CONTRIBUTION TO OUR Push Pull Cardio Campaign.


I am Alan Ashley, the guy behind Push Pull Cardio. Being an Air Force veteran and a father of three, I am well-versed in dealing with challenges and overcoming barriers to success. In 2012, I was faced with two of the most difficult situations someone could face. My older brother fell into a coma that nearly claimed his life and weeks later I lost my oldest daughter to cancer. Both of these situations changed me forever.  I wanted to be a part of something bigger than myself and to help others in their pursuit of healthier lifestyles. 
My Education and Certifications:

Masters in Business Administration
American Council on Exercise - Certified Personal Trainer
American Heart Association - CPR/AED

Serving the Community

PPC conducts outdoor group fitness classes every Saturday and Sunday starting 8AM. Our classes provide a intense yet fun workout that helps each member get a few steps closer towards reaching their goals. Your help will help us expand this program, allowing us to move indoors and offer classes several times EVERY DAY. This is important because your contributions will give families in the community a low cost solution to receive training by a certified trainer.
What We Need
With your support, we are raising the $30,000 needed to fully fund our first fitness studio. With that we will be able to obtain a building along with the purchasing of all equipment needed. 100% of your contribution will go to pay for the studio.
Equipment Needs
TRX Mounting System, TRX Suspension Trainers, Rubber Flooring

Other Specialized Equipment (Not All Shown Here)

What You Get
You will be helping children and families around the world as we donate a portion of our profits to organizations which fight life-threatening diseases (more below).
We didn't forget about you either!  :) All contributions are welcome!

$1 - Thank You - Any amount helps. A heartfelt thanks for helping make Push Pull Cardio a reality!!
$10 - Supporter - All of the above + Facebook and website shout out as a supporter of Push Pull Cardio.
$15 - Silver Supporter - All of the above + Push Pull Cardio Wristband
$25 - Friend - All of the above + personalized thank you letter.
$50 - Endorser - All of the above + limited edition Push Pull Cardio sackpack.
$100 - Sponsor (Old) - All of the above + limited edition Push Pull Cardio T-Shirt.
$250 - Sponsor (New) - All of the above + limited edition Push Pull Cardio Sweater.
$1000 - Patron -All of the above + suspension training system with customize workout. + Name engraved on Founder's Plague.
$2500 - Champion- All of the above + workout created and named in your honor. Workout will be done each year the month of our anniversary. + Name engraved on Founder's Plaque.

Women's Push Pull Cardio Limited Edition T-Shirt Mock-up

 
Men's Push Pull Cardio Limited Edition T-Shirt Mock-up


At PPC, not only do we have a mission of creating healthy lifestyles, we are also in the fight to cure life-threatening diseases in children. Being a parent and having endured the loss of a child to cancer, I know firsthand the impact childhood disease has on the whole family. When I lost my daughter, the amount of support we received was incredible. PPC wants to help other families going through similar situations before they have to experience the loss of their child.
What Does This Really Mean?
Your contributions would help on two fronts.  First, did you know The United States is one of the world's most overweight nations with over 31% of adults being obese?  With your help we can make an impact on a community by providing an affordable solution.
Second, with 20% of PPC's profits being donated to charities assisting in the prevention of childhood diseases, the true impact of your contributions will be multiplied and felt by families around the world for years to come.
Other Ways You Can Help

Help me get the word out and make some noise about our project by sharing and reposting on Facebook, Twitter, Google+, Instagram and other forums.
Please use the Indiegogo share tools, as this will help this project gain exposure and get it listed on the front pages of Indiegogo.
Again, please spread the word and tell ALL your friends. You'll help make the world a healthier place to live in. Thank you!

story:
What is OvarCare?

OvarCare is a support program offered by Ovarcome Non-Profit Inc. for ovarian cancer patients in active treatment at MD Anderson Cancer Center, Houston, TX.

At Ovarcome, we are inspired by the simple philosophy of support, love, and celebration of life. Overcoming cancer - celebrating life! We are here to help women as they fight the battle against ovarian cancer. Our care package helps them take care of essentials as they undergo treatment while feeling relaxed, peaceful, calm and beautiful. OvarCare is a package especially designed for ovarian cancer patients in need for financial assistance – to celebrate these incredibly strong and resilient women.

What does OvarCare offer?

•  Financial grant of $200

•  Health restoration consultation at The Healing Space by Dr. Monica Roberson– 1 hour (worth at $350)

•  $100 Gas card

•  $100 grocery card

•  A $50 gift certificate to Cure & Co. – a cancer wellness boutique and spa

Who is it for? It is for ovarian cancer patients who:

·  Have a diagnosis of ovarian cancer certified by an oncology healthcare provider

·  Are in active treatment at MD Anderson, main and regional centers in Houston and Greater Houston areas

·  Are a newly diagnosed or existing ovarian cancer patient

·  Are currently Texas residents (we will increase our locational scope 3-6 months upon initiation)

·  Meet our financial eligibility guidelines of 265% of the Federal Poverty Limits and are able to provide income verification documentation

How can eligible patients apply?

The application process has been designed in partnership with MD Anderson. Details of application and disbursement of the OvarCare package will be shared with patients upon selection.

How can YOU support the OvarCare program?

  • The OvarCare package is worth $800. Currently we are offering one care package/month. With collective support, we could offer the care package to more patients who would benefit from this assistance. Your total cost to sponsor one OvarCare package is $500
  • You can choose to sponsor 1, 2, 3 or as many women/ovarian cancer patients as you would like to support. You can also choose to co-sponsor with 1 or 2 friends
  • Should you choose to sponsor OvarCare, we will disburse the gift in honor of the name you select. It would be something like OvarCare: A Smith Family Gift OR OvarCare: A Smith & Jones Family Gift (should you choose to co-sponsor)
  • We will share primary patient information (barring any confidential clinical information) with all sponsors
  • We will feature each sponsor on our website every month (with names and pictures if you give us approval)
  • All OvarCare packages will initially be disbursed to Texas residents only. We will increase the scope of giving 3-6 months upon initiation 
Your contribution is tax-deductible. 100% of your donation will go towards OvarCare.


OUR PLAN: 1 patient/month

OUR GOAL:  5 patients/month

Help us make a difference. Your contribution directly impacts and improves the life of an underprivileged woman who is fighting the battle against ovarian cancer in the hope of overcoming it.

Background on Ovarcome: 

Our mission at Ovarcome is to raise awareness on ovarian cancer among women worldwide and to provide treatment support to underprivileged women in developing nations. We partner with MD Anderson, The Methodist Hospital, Rice University, Christian Ministries of Africa, IACAN, AYZH and several other organizations in the US. Our partnership in India is with Tata Medical Center where we work with their team of doctors and social workers to identify underprivileged women diagnosed with ovarian cancer who could benefit from our financial support, and sponsor their chemotherapy treatments. You can learn more about our work, and the distinguished group of individuals who are associated with our Board by visiting  www.ovarcome.org and facebook.com/ovarcome. 

In 2013, in observance of ovarian cancer awareness month in September, we partnered with Christian Ministries of Africa (CMA) to distribute awareness postcards to hundreds of women in Langata, and Kibera outside of Nairobi, Kenya. Kibera is the largest slum area of Africa. Our representatives talked to women in these regions about the signs & symptoms of ovarian cancer and discussed treatment options with them.

We also hosted a workshop in Pune, India led by our Advisory Board member, Dr. Shona Nag. The workshop - "Women's Cancers - Symptoms, Prevention and Screening" was conducted in September 2013 by eminent Oncologist and a leading voice in the field of women's cancer therapy, Dr. Shona Nag, who addressed around 100 underprivileged women on various common cancers like breast, cervical, ovarian etc. that afflict women. The workshop was followed by the distribution of the Ovarcome Awareness Postcards (translated in Hindi). This workshop was conducted in association with Poona United Round Table 144, a member of Round Table India, an Indian non-profit, working extensively in the field of education for the underprivileged in India.

Ovarcome was founded by Runsi Sen, the President and CEO, in loving memory of her beloved mother. Runsi's mother passed away from an aggressive form of ovarian cancer in February 2009. In her memory and with her inspiration, she created Ovarcome. Runsi 's dream is to see a world free from the scourge of cancer. Awareness is key as diagnosis in early stages can save lives. She is committed to this cause....."I 'm devoting the rest of my life to saving lives of women around the world through education, awareness, empowerment, early action, and treatment support for underprivileged." - Runsi Sen



How else can you help?

Volunteer Your Time:
Is health, wellness and healing your passion?
Make an impact locally or globally.
Help us save the lives of women!
Got Skills?
Can’t get off Facebook? Always Twittering? Intrigued by Pinterest? If you think you got Social Media all figured out, let us know how should we maximize it for our cause!
Finance jock?
Creative Marketing and Communications guru?
Graphics artist!
Learnt Web Development in kindergarten?
Join us and help save the lives of women worldwide.

Stay Involved:

Like us and join the conversation
Share an idea or a story
Spread the word

  • Please help us get the word out 
  • Please share our campaign on your social media pages/platforms
  • Sign up your family and friends to contribute to OvarCare
  • Contact us at ovarcome@gmail.com if you would like to volunteer with us 

Thank you for your support!

story:
Still interested in Lively Wearable? 
CLICK HERE to sign up to learn when Lively Wearable will be available for everyone.


Lively Wearable is the latest innovation from GreatCall, the leader in creating usable technology for active aging.  We're pre-launching the device on Indiegogo, because we want to reward early adopters with special pricing. Supporters on Indiegogo will get Lively Wearable (normally $99) and a set number of months of 5Star Service (normally $14.99/month) at a special price. Explore our perk packages.

No matter how much money we raise, our supporters will receive the Lively Wearable perk that they select.


Introducing Lively Wearable - the stylish activity tracker that offers a discreet emergency response button. 

  • On a daily basis, Lively Wearable connects to Mom's smartphone* to count steps and offer daily challenges to help her stay active. 
  • In case of emergency, Mom presses the button on her device to connect via her smartphone to highly trained agents that can assess her situation and get her the help she needs.


*Lively Wearable will be compatible with Android 4.3 BLE devices in Spring 2016. iOS support coming Summer 2016.




As Featured In


What Makes Lively Wearable Different

Technology that Simplifies

Mom never leaves home without her smartphone, but could she find it, unlock the screen, and call for help in an emergency? Lively Wearable makes calling for help as easy as pressing a button – no finicky lock screens to grapple with under stress.

         

   

Once Mom hits the button she’s connected to a 5Star Agent that’s armed with her personal profile, listing details like medications, conditions or even where a spare key is hidden. These details empower the agent to provide personalized help, so that emergency support can arrive quickly and informed. Meanwhile, as soon as the call ends, your Link app alerts you and lets you know her location.

Mom Stays Active

We designed every aspect of the Lively Wearable for seniors, from a comfortable, easy to fasten band to an exciting from app for everyday motivation.  Beautifully designed and themed around travel, the Lively App encourages Mom to keep exploring, by offering daily mind and body challenges. Each challenge is designed for people like her, so she has fun and stays motivated.

You Get Peace of Mind

With just a few taps on your smartphone, the GreatCall Link app assures you that Mom is safe, staying active and meeting her goals. She can feel safer knowing that if she does call 5Star for help, you’ll be sent an alert with her location, making it easier to be there for her when she needs you.

            

Two Colors, Two Ways to Wear

The Lively Wearable can be worn around the neck or on the wrist. Fall detection is enabled when worn around the neck with the accompanying lanyard.  The device is available in two colors, white with gold trim, or gray with chrome trim, so you can pick a look that fits Mom’s style.

If Lively Wearable detects a fall, the device initiates a call via the user’s smartphone to GreatCall’s 5Star Service where a highly trained agent can assist. In the event that the user doesn’t respond to the agent, emergency services will be dispatched to their location.

Easy, Three Step Set Up

That's it! Lively Wearable is easy to set up and easy to use. Plus, we offer live, US-based tech support, so Mom can reach help if she needs it.


What Our Customers Are Saying About GreatCall's 5Star Service

Lively Wearable is our first wearable device. But, GreatCall's 5Star service has been helping to keep seniors safe via our other products, like our GreatCall Splash and the Jitterbug phone since 2012. 

The Perks

Support Lively Wearable now, for the lowest pricing.


Know someone that might
like Lively Wearable? 

 The person who generates the highest value of referrals* to our campaign will win a trip to San Diego to meet the product team at GreatCall. Use Indiegogo's share tools while logged into your Indiegogo account to make sure your referrals count.

*Open to US residents age 18 or older who have purchased a Lively Wearable perk through Great Call’s Indiegogo Campaign Page.  Internet access and Indiegogo account are required to participate.  Void in MD and where prohibited.  Starts noon PT on 2/8/16 and ends at 11:59:59pm PT on 3/22/16.  Subject to Official Contest Rules.  

Designed for Seniors
Every Step of the Way

Throughout our design process, we’ve continued to learn. We’ve reviewed research from reputable sources like AARP and the Consumer Electronics Association (CEA).  We’ve taken our prototypes to local senior centers to get feedback from actual seniors on the wearable’s design and app experience. 

We’ve talked to family caregivers about their needs, and designed a new version of our Link app that gives them peace of mind without oversharing their parent's details.

Manufacturing Has Begun!

We are proud to announce that we have begun manufacturing of this device. 

Molds for Lively Wearable

At GreatCall, we marry the best technology with clean design and intuitive usability, because we believe that technology should be accessible to everyone. We started with the Jitterbug cell phone in 2007, and over the years we have improved our mobile phones, and expanded our offerings to include health and safety technology, like our innovative 5Star service.


When we ship in Spring of 2016, Lively Wearable will reflect the years of experience with thoughtful senior-focused product design that we pride ourselves on at GreatCall. 

Lively Wearable is just the first step in this process.  We plan to evolve the platform to add numerous more features like monitoring blood pressure and blood sugar. We are dedicated to continuing the learning process and we want to hear what excites our users, and their families.

Why We’re Here

Lively Wearable is a new category of product for GreatCall, and we believe in creating products for people. We’ve built our company by listening to the needs of our customers and Lively Wearable is no different.  

At our core, we're a team of engineers and product developers.  Every one of us knows someone that could benefit - today or in the near future - from a product  that that helps them age actively and gives them access to support. 

Lively Wearable might not be right for you, but if you've got a parent, or friend that wants to feel safe, or needs the confidence to be a little more active, it might be right for them.

We've launched this campaign because we want to reach people that get technology – people like you. We believe that you can help us make our product better by giving us your feedback, by trying our apps and by sharing Lively Wearable with someone you know that might find it helpful. Most of the user experience of this product lives within the App, which allows us to modify and evolve the product easily, so we can keep improving Lively Wearable, even once it's in your hands.

The Collaboration Behind Lively Wearable

We're proud Lively Wearable will be designed and assembled in the United States. We pride ourselves on working with as many local companies as possible, and many of our partners in the production of this device are located close by in Southern California. 


  • Mindflow in Carlsbad, CA created all of the industrial design, including the appearance of jewel, pendant and strap. They’re the ones behind the sleek design that makes Lively Wearable different. They’ve been an essential partner to us since the beginning, and have helped keep the the manufacturing process moving.  
  • BioSensics in Cambridge, MA provided the activity monitoring and fall detection algorithms that allow us to get Mom help – even when she can’t call for it – and they’ve helped us create the firmware and circuit board design, which are the guts of Lively Wearable. 
  • Distinctive Plastics, in Vista California, created the pendant and the wristband using a two shot process called “multi-component molding” 
  • Dutek in Vista, is the contract manufacturer who has fabricated the printed circuit board assembly, and who will ultimately assemble the Lively Wearable
  • Enstrom Mold & Engineering, San Marcos, CA created the plastics for the jewel (Lively Wearable) itself 

Helping Seniors Age Actively

According to the National Institutes of Health, being physically active regularly is one of the healthiest things that seniors can do. Staying active daily has been shown to have positive effects many of the most common conditions that impact older adults, including high blood pressure, arthritis, heart disease, diabetes -- even cognitive function and depression. 

Lively Wearable is different than other activity trackers.  We tailored the unique set of features to fit the needs of older adults and help them stay active, live well and be safe. Daily challenges offer approachable tasks that are easy to complete, and virtual rewards to keep seniors motivated. 

Designing Lively Wearable

We wanted a partner that was committed to understanding the specific needs of the older population, so we partnered with BioSensics, a Cambridge-based biomedical firm specialized in wearable technologies with clinically validated and peer-evaluated algorithmic detection of motion, falls and senior specific activities.  


Cutting Edge Fall Detection

Lively Wearable is equipped with fall detection technology utilizing a triaxial accelerometer with patented algorithms developed by BioSensics, a company specializing in wearable sensors for health care. The algorithm evaluates sudden changes in body movement in relation to the user’s physical activity and posture to identify falls.  Fall detection is only available when the Lively Wearable is worn around the neck, with the provided lanyard.  

Enhanced GPS for Precision Location Tracking

GreatCall Lively Wearable uses enhanced GPS with patented locating technology, to allow agents to quickly and accurately pinpoint Mom’s location to dispatch emergency personnel and to notify you.

Secure Communication Between Devices

The Lively Wearable uses MQTT using IBM MessageSight, the technology powering the Internet of Things, to securely send data between mobile apps and the cloud and Bluetooth LE (4.0) to power secure communications with minimal power drain and maximum range. We selected IBM MessageSight because they offered a scalable solution, with enterprise grade support and security, which are essential when creating an emergency device. Their solution will allow Lively Wearable to communicate with the Lively and Link apps, as well as the GreatCall Cloud, securely and efficiently. 

GreatCall Cloud is our cloud-based server for collecting, processing and analyzing data directly from your Mom’s Lively app that can then be shared with designated family, emergency responders and medical personnel.

The Result

Lively Wearable works with Mom’s smartphone to keep her safe. The ongoing $14.99/month plan means she gets:

  • A beautiful activity tracker with a battery that that lasts up to six months without charging
  • An easily replaceable battery
  • The option to wear on wrist or around the neck
  • Clear, personalized response through her smartphone when Mom presses the button
  • Unlimited access to GreatCall’s award winning 5Star Service
  • Peace of mind that highly trained professionals are ready to respond and assist your family.

The perks above each include a set number of months of service. After the promotional service has ended, the Lively Wearable requires a service plan at $14.99 per month.

Lively Wearable Product Specs

What’s in the Box?

The Lively Wearable box includes the Lively Wearable Device, matching wristband, lanyard for use around the neck, and coin cell battery.

Project Timeline

We have begun manufacturing and testing.  Our IndieGoGo backers will receive their products before any other orders are fulfilled.


FAQs

Q:  Does the Lively Wearable need to be linked with a smartphone?
A:  Yes. The Lively Wearable is not a cellphone, so it needs to be linked to a smartphone to contact 5Star and complete daily challenges.
Q:  Can you speak through the Lively Wearable?
A:  No. The smartphone is used for all conversations.
Q:  How far can the Lively Wearable be from a smartphone?
A:  The Lively Wearable counts steps whenever you’re wearing it. It uses Bluetooth to connect to your smartphone, to call 5Star, upload your step count or share your location in case of an emergency. The typical range for Bluetooth technology is 150 feet line of sight.
Q:  What happens if you can’t hear the phone when you attempt an emergency call?
A:  Emergency services are automatically contacted if the user does not respond in 5 minutes.
Q.   How does fall detection work?
A:  The Lively Wearable detects falls when worn around the neck with the lanyard that accompanies the device. In case of a fall, the Lively Wearable will alert 5Star agents, who will initiate an emergency response protocol.
Q:  How long does the battery last? Can I get new batteries?
A:  The battery lasts up to six months without charging.  It’s easy to replace with a coin cell battery, which can be found in stores nationwide. 
Q:  Does the Lively Wearable require a monthly service plan?
A:  Yes.  The Lively Wearable plan costs $14.99 per month. You will need to continue your smartphone service plan with your current provider. If you purchase a perk with service included, when you activate your device, you'll provide a credit card number, and you will be billed once your pre-purchased service has been used up.
Q:  When using the Link app, will I be able to see my Mom’s location at all times?
A:   No. The Link app only transmits a user’s location in case of emergency - if a fall is detected or a 5Star call is initiated.

Risks & Challenges

Lively Wearable is nearly complete. All images shown on this page and in the video were built or developed by our teams in the United States.  We’re currently ramping up at our factory and are ready to meet the estimated delivery times.

Forecasting Risk

We’ve done our very best to forecast demand and create a solid production plan. We’ve learned a lot from the past nine years, but sometimes forecasts don’t always hit the mark. Should we miss projections, we’ll let you know why and make it right as quickly as possible.

Supply Chain Risk

If this happens, we’ll be sure to keep you informed and work to quickly solve the problem.

Terms and Conditions

Our privacy policy is available at https://www.greatcall.com/legal/privacy-policy. 

Our 5Star terms and conditions can be found at: https://www.greatcall.com/legal/5Star-terms-conditions 

Our terms of use can be found at: https://www.greatcall.com/legal/terms-of-use  

Questions?

Leave a comment here, or shoot our campaign manager, Erin Byram, an email at erin.byram@greatcall.com.

Technology that Simplifies
 Mom never leaves home without her smartphone, but could she find it, unlock the screen, and call for help in an emergency? Lively Wearable makes calling for help as easy as pressing a button – no finicky lock screens to grapple with under stress.
          
   
 Once Mom hits the button she’s connected to a 5Star Agent that’s armed with her personal profile, listing details like medications, conditions or even where a spare key is hidden. These details empower the agent to provide personalized help, so that emergency support can arrive quickly and informed. Meanwhile, as soon as the call ends, your Link app alerts you and lets you know her location. 


Mom Stays Active
We designed every aspect of the Lively Wearable for seniors, from a comfortable, easy to fasten band to an exciting from app for everyday motivation.  Beautifully designed and themed around travel, the Lively App encourages Mom to keep exploring, by offering daily mind and body challenges. Each challenge is designed for people like her, so she has fun and stays motivated.





You Get Peace of Mind
With just a few taps on your smartphone, the GreatCall Link app assures you that Mom is safe, staying active and meeting her goals. She can feel safer knowing that if she does call 5Star for help, you’ll be sent an alert with her location, making it easier to be there for her when she needs you.


            


Two Colors, Two Ways to Wear 
 The Lively Wearable can be worn around the neck or on the wrist. Fall detection is enabled when worn around the neck with the accompanying lanyard.  The device is available in two colors, white with gold trim, or gray with chrome trim, so you can pick a look that fits Mom’s style. 
 If Lively Wearable detects a fall, the device initiates a call via the user’s smartphone to GreatCall’s 5Star Service where a highly trained agent can assist. In the event that the user doesn’t respond to the agent, emergency services will be dispatched to their location.
                


 


Easy, Three Step Set Up



That's it! Lively Wearable is easy to set up and easy to use. Plus, we offer live, US-based tech support, so Mom can reach help if she needs it.


What Our Customers Are Saying About GreatCall's 5Star Service
Lively Wearable is our first wearable device. But, GreatCall's 5Star service has been helping to keep seniors safe via our other products, like our GreatCall Splash and the Jitterbug phone since 2012. 

 


The Perks
Support Lively Wearable now, for the lowest pricing. 





Know someone that mightlike Lively Wearable? 



 The person who generates the highest value of referrals* to our campaign will win a trip to San Diego to meet the product team at GreatCall. Use Indiegogo's share tools while logged into your Indiegogo account to make sure your referrals count.
*Open to US residents age 18 or older who have purchased a Lively Wearable perk through Great Call’s Indiegogo Campaign Page.  Internet access and Indiegogo account are required to participate.  Void in MD and where prohibited.  Starts noon PT on 2/8/16 and ends at 11:59:59pm PT on 3/22/16.  Subject to Official Contest Rules.  



Designed for Seniors Every Step of the Way
 Throughout our design process, we’ve continued to learn. We’ve reviewed research from reputable sources like AARP and the Consumer Electronics Association (CEA).  We’ve taken our prototypes to local senior centers to get feedback from actual seniors on the wearable’s design and app experience.  



 We’ve talked to family caregivers about their needs, and designed a new version of our Link app that gives them peace of mind without oversharing their parent's details.
                



Manufacturing Has Begun!
 We are proud to announce that we have begun manufacturing of this device. 



Molds for Lively Wearable 
 At GreatCall, we marry the best technology with clean design and intuitive usability, because we believe that technology should be accessible to everyone. We started with the Jitterbug cell phone in 2007, and over the years we have improved our mobile phones, and expanded our offerings to include health and safety technology, like our innovative 5Star service. 




 When we ship in Spring of 2016, Lively Wearable will reflect the years of experience with thoughtful senior-focused product design that we pride ourselves on at GreatCall.  



Lively Wearable is just the first step in this process.  We plan to evolve the platform to add numerous more features like monitoring blood pressure and blood sugar. We are dedicated to continuing the learning process and we want to hear what excites our users, and their families.


Why We’re Here
 Lively Wearable is a new category of product for GreatCall, and we believe in creating products for people. We’ve built our company by listening to the needs of our customers and Lively Wearable is no different.   
 At our core, we're a team of engineers and product developers.  Every one of us knows someone that could benefit - today or in the near future - from a product  that that helps them age actively and gives them access to support. 


Lively Wearable might not be right for you, but if you've got a parent, or friend that wants to feel safe, or needs the confidence to be a little more active, it might be right for them. 
 We've launched this campaign because we want to reach people that get technology – people like you. We believe that you can help us make our product better by giving us your feedback, by trying our apps and by sharing Lively Wearable with someone you know that might find it helpful. Most of the user experience of this product lives within the App, which allows us to modify and evolve the product easily, so we can keep improving Lively Wearable, even once it's in your hands.


The Collaboration Behind Lively Wearable


We're proud Lively Wearable will be designed and assembled in the United States. We pride ourselves on working with as many local companies as possible, and many of our partners in the production of this device are located close by in Southern California. 





Mindflow in Carlsbad, CA created all of the industrial design, including the appearance of jewel, pendant and strap. They’re the ones behind the sleek design that makes Lively Wearable different. They’ve been an essential partner to us since the beginning, and have helped keep the the manufacturing process moving.  

BioSensics in Cambridge, MA provided the activity monitoring and fall detection algorithms that allow us to get Mom help – even when she can’t call for it – and they’ve helped us create the firmware and circuit board design, which are the guts of Lively Wearable. 

Distinctive Plastics, in Vista California, created the pendant and the wristband using a two shot process called “multi-component molding” 

Dutek in Vista, is the contract manufacturer who has fabricated the printed circuit board assembly, and who will ultimately assemble the Lively Wearable

Enstrom Mold & Engineering, San Marcos, CA created the plastics for the jewel (Lively Wearable) itself 




Helping Seniors Age Actively



 According to the National Institutes of Health, being physically active regularly is one of the healthiest things that seniors can do. Staying active daily has been shown to have positive effects many of the most common conditions that impact older adults, including high blood pressure, arthritis, heart disease, diabetes -- even cognitive function and depression.  
 Lively Wearable is different than other activity trackers.  We tailored the unique set of features to fit the needs of older adults and help them stay active, live well and be safe. Daily challenges offer approachable tasks that are easy to complete, and virtual rewards to keep seniors motivated.  

 


Designing Lively Wearable


We wanted a partner that was committed to understanding the specific needs of the older population, so we partnered with BioSensics, a Cambridge-based biomedical firm specialized in wearable technologies with clinically validated and peer-evaluated algorithmic detection of motion, falls and senior specific activities.  






 Cutting
      Edge Fall Detection 
 Lively Wearable is equipped with fall detection technology utilizing a triaxial accelerometer with patented algorithms developed by BioSensics, a company specializing in wearable sensors for health care. The algorithm evaluates sudden changes in body movement in relation to the user’s physical activity and posture to identify falls.  Fall detection is only available when the Lively Wearable is worn around the neck, with the provided lanyard.   


 Enhanced
      GPS for Precision Location Tracking 
 GreatCall Lively Wearable uses enhanced GPS with patented locating technology, to allow agents to quickly and accurately pinpoint Mom’s location to dispatch emergency personnel and to notify you. 

 


 Secure
      Communication Between Devices 
 The Lively Wearable uses MQTT using IBM MessageSight, the technology powering the Internet of Things, to securely send data between mobile apps and the cloud and Bluetooth LE (4.0) to power secure communications with minimal power drain and maximum range. We selected IBM MessageSight because they offered a scalable solution, with enterprise grade support and security, which are essential when creating an emergency device. Their solution will allow Lively Wearable to communicate with the Lively and Link apps, as well as the GreatCall Cloud, securely and efficiently. 
 GreatCall Cloud is our cloud-based server for collecting, processing and analyzing data directly from your Mom’s Lively app that can then be shared with designated family, emergency responders and medical personnel. 


The Result
 Lively Wearable works with Mom’s smartphone to keep her safe. The ongoing $14.99/month plan means she gets: 

A beautiful activity tracker with a battery that that lasts up to six months without charging
An easily replaceable battery
The option to wear on wrist or around the neck
Clear, personalized response through her smartphone when Mom presses the button
Unlimited access to GreatCall’s award winning 5Star Service
Peace of mind that highly trained professionals are ready to respond and assist your family.

 The perks above each include a set number of months of service. After the promotional service has ended, the Lively Wearable requires a service plan at $14.99 per month. 

 


Lively Wearable Product Specs

 


What’s in the Box?
 The Lively Wearable box includes the Lively Wearable Device, matching wristband, lanyard for use around the neck, and coin cell battery. 


Project Timeline
 We have begun manufacturing and testing.  Our IndieGoGo backers will receive their products before any other orders are fulfilled.





FAQs

Q:  Does the Lively Wearable need to be linked with a smartphone?
A:  Yes. The Lively Wearable is not a cellphone, so it needs to be linked to a smartphone to contact 5Star and complete daily challenges.
Q:  Can you speak through the Lively Wearable?
A:  No. The smartphone is used for all conversations.
Q:  How far can the Lively Wearable be from a smartphone?
A:  The Lively Wearable counts steps whenever you’re wearing it. It uses Bluetooth to connect to your smartphone, to call 5Star, upload your step count or share your location in case of an emergency. The typical range for Bluetooth technology is 150 feet line of sight.
Q:  What happens if you can’t hear the phone when you attempt an emergency call?
A:  Emergency services are automatically contacted if the user does not respond in 5 minutes.
Q.   How does fall detection work?
A:  The Lively Wearable detects falls when worn around the neck with the lanyard that accompanies the device. In case of a fall, the Lively Wearable will alert 5Star agents, who will initiate an emergency response protocol.
Q:  How long does the battery last? Can I get new batteries?
A:  The battery lasts up to six months without charging.  It’s easy to replace with a coin cell battery, which can be found in stores nationwide. 
Q:  Does the Lively Wearable require a monthly service plan?
A:  Yes.  The Lively Wearable plan costs $14.99 per month. You will need to continue your smartphone service plan with your current provider. If you purchase a perk with service included, when you activate your device, you'll provide a credit card number, and you will be billed once your pre-purchased service has been used up.
Q:  When using the Link app, will I be able to see my Mom’s location at all times?
A:   No. The Link app only transmits a user’s location in case of emergency - if a fall is detected or a 5Star call is initiated.



Risks & Challenges
 Lively Wearable is nearly complete. All images shown on this page and in the video were built or developed by our teams in the United States.  We’re currently ramping up at our factory and are ready to meet the estimated delivery times. 


Forecasting Risk
 We’ve done our very best to forecast demand and create a solid production plan. We’ve learned a lot from the past nine years, but sometimes forecasts don’t always hit the mark. Should we miss projections, we’ll let you know why and make it right as quickly as possible. 


Supply Chain Risk
 If this happens, we’ll be sure to keep you informed and work to quickly solve the problem. 


Terms and Conditions
Our privacy policy is available at https://www.greatcall.com/legal/privacy-policy. 
Our 5Star terms and conditions can be found at: https://www.greatcall.com/legal/5Star-terms-conditions 
Our terms of use can be found at: https://www.greatcall.com/legal/terms-of-use  
Questions?

Leave a comment here, or shoot our campaign manager, Erin Byram, an email at erin.byram@greatcall.com.

story:
Thank you for taking the time to visit this page. I am grateful for you even coming here when there are so many people that are in need of help from others.

My name is Latisha and i am a very strong person and asking for assistance is very hard for me but i had to put aside my pride and have faith that i will make it through this very difficult time. I come from a broken home, my mom left me at 5 and i don't know who my father is and was raised by my aunt and had a very rough upbringing. I have alwyas tried to remain positive throughout all of life's trials and tribulations. I truly believe that when you put positive energy into the universe that is exactly what you get back.

Getting this surgey will mean the world to me and will possibly save my life. i am very afraid but i have faith. i am 30 years old and don't have any kids and when they told me they recommend a hysterectomy my heart dropped because it was my dream to always have atleast one child. But even without being able to have a baby my two adorable dogs paris & snoflake still give me great joy.
 
The surgery will cost anywhere between 3500 and 7000. There will be other costs for trips to the hospital as i get prepared for the surgery as well as medication and recovery after but i can only ask for the max for the surgery. Each and everyone that that is kind enough to donate atleast 100 dollars to me i will personally call you and express my genunine gratitude.
 

It really hurts that i dont have family there for me to help me through this but i belive we are all family and there for each other. Please feel free to share my story and i thank you so so much for listening and even if you are not able to donate i am grateful for your time and consideration. May God Bless You!

Thank you for you support.

story:
My wife Kendra and I are the Founders of the MS Fitness Challenge (MSFC), a
cause to help people with multiple sclerosis become educated and trained in a
lifestyle of health & fitness to battle this debilitating and incurable
disease. MSFC is the only MS cause of its kind.

I was diagnosed with MS in 2006 at the age of 47 and as a former bodybuilder
and health club owner, I chose to take the disease head on through
bodybuilding. Since that time I have won Most Inspirational at the FL State
Bodybuilding Championship in 2009 at 50 years old after being told I was
wheelchair bound; I’ve been featured on TV, radio and print; I have a book on
the market in Barnes & Noble and other outlets about my battle against MS
called David’s Goliath, endorsed by Montel Williams and other celebrities; a
movie production company is in discussions on a feature film on my story (the
documentary starts in Dec); and most importantly I started the MSFC with Kendra
to help others.

There is much happening in my fight against MS, as I
prepare to compete in a bodybuilding contest again at 55, but the most
important aspect of this journey is how Kendra and I am helping others with MS realize that the road to victory is in the gym.

MS is a very debilitating disease leaving us with damage to our nerves that
typically makes life and its simple tasks very difficult. It is a disease of
pain, numbness, coordination issues and with many symptoms that make our lives
daily almost unbearable. MS can put people in a state of despair if they let
it. We founded the MSFC to change lives and help those with MS have hope, goals
and a lifestyle of health & fitness.

The MSFC is endorsed by celebrities such as La Toya Jackson and country
music singer Julie Roberts amongst others. We recently held an MSFC event at an
independently owned gym in the small town of Sartell, MN where Julie, who has MS,
performed. The event was a tremendous success as we enrolled people with MS as
Challenge participants (more than 20% of all people with MS in that area)
providing them with trainers, supplements and a gym membership free of cost. My
organization pays for this through the donations of supporters and fundraising.
The event was covered by local news and was promoted by the National MS
Society. I am being approached by people with MS from all over the country
asking to get involved in the Challenge.

You can see on our website www.msfitnesschallenge.org what we are doing
and how much we are accomplishing. This has been my wife and I promoting the
cause but now it’s time for us to take this Challenge to other markets and we
need the help of others and the financial support to do so. We currently have
an event planned in the Orlando, FL area on Jan 18, another in San Diego in Feb and one in NY to follow.

We need your help to make sure the participants at the Orlando event have all the funds needed to provide the support from the MSFC since there is NO cost to them to join.

MSFC Mission
Statement:

The MS Fitness Challenge (MSFC) seeks to closely partner
with people who have been diagnosed with Multiple Sclerosis (MS) in order to
assist them in overcoming the barriers and challenges associated with their
illness. MSFC will create and implement a 12-week fitness program designed to
improve the quality of life for those living with MS.

MSFC Vision:

It is the Goal of the MSFC to provide a 12 week training
program by offering certified fitness professionals through host gym
memberships. MSFC will also offer nutritional guidance and ongoing advice to
people with MS during their program. The intent of MSFC is to continue to serve a nationwide participant base in an effort to
provide education and training on the benefits of health & fitness
to assist them in winning the battle against Multiple Sclerosis.

YOUR DONATION goes directly to paying for:

A trainer to work individually with an MSFC
participant for the 12 week Challenge

A 12 week gym membership at the Host Gym

A 12 week supply of nutritional supplements

Ongoing telephone and/or email support from the
MSFC Team of Coordinators during the 12 week program. The coordinator team will
include health, nursing, nutrition and fitness experts.

HELP SUPPORT THOSE WITH MS LIVE A MORE PRODUCTIVE LIFE IN THEIR BATTLE AGAINST THIS INCURABLE DISEASE...DONATE TO THE MSFC TODAY!

ALL FUNDS WILL GO TO SUPPORT THE JANUARY 18, 2014 KISSIMMEE, FL EVENT BEING HELD AT CARDIO HOUSE FITNESS.

story:
I was diagnosed with lung cancer in December of 2013 (I stopped smoking in 2004) and had the lower lobe of my left lung removed in January of 2014. On February 10th 2014 I will start 35 radiation, and 4 chemotherapy treatments over the course of of 7 weeks.  I haven't been able to return to work since my surgery because my ribs and the cartilage around them are inflamed. I don't know when they will improve.  Most people also experience fatigue while undergoing treatment which would make it difficult to return to work.  All of this combined places a great financial hardship on me. 

I would be tremendously thankful for any contributions you could make to my fund.  It would be used for living expenses and gas for the trips to treatment which are 100 miles round trip per day.  It would mean the world to me!  I'm pretty independent, but alas, not independently wealthy!  We can all use some humor every now and then. 

If you are able to contribute, I prefer you use PayPay, as I will have instant access to those funds. You don't need a PayPal account.  You can sign in as a guest. You can however also pay by credit or debit card directly on the indiegogo site but that money is held until the end of the campaign.  Indiegogo was recommended in an article by Forbes magazine. I did my research!

I would also appreciate your spreading the word to anyone you think might be interested through email, Facebook, and other social media.  Indiegogo has some sharing tools that help with that.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Stacie Becker, and I am a tattooer at Hurts So Good Tattoo in Altamonte Springs, FL. Every year my husband and I like to participate in fundraisers on behalf of our business to help causes that hit home for us. This year we decided to go about it in a different way.

After having a baby this last year, I started thinking about the struggles some parents face when dealing with issues out of their control concerning their child. One of these issues are the various forms of children's cancer. I can't imagine having to watch my own child struggle with cancer, and this thought has inspired me to want to help raise funds for a great nonprofit organization called Cure Search for Children's Cancer. (You can find more info on this great organization at www.curesearch.org) 

If we reach our goal of $500, I decided that I would shave my head and donate my hair to Pantene's Beautiful Lengths. All of the money we raise will go to help fund Cure Search for Children's Cancer so they can continue to fund and support targeted and innovative children's cancer research with measurable results, and be the authoritative source of information and resources for all those affected by children's cancer.

What We Need & What You Get

We need any amount of funds you are willing to give. The more we raise, the more help we can give this great organization. By donating, you will also get to watch me shave my head. If you are donating at least $10 and you are local, I will also offer a free poster print of one of my paintings (3 different prints available) if you can come to the shop to pick it up (while supplies last). Hurts So Good Tattoo is located at 788 N State Rd 434 #108 in Altamonte Springs, FL 32714

The Impact

This first started out with me wanting to donate my hair and any money raised to a charity that provided wigs to children with cancer, but then I decided that the best way to help children with cancer is to help keep them from needing these wigs in the first place. I believe that our donations will be better served going to help find a cure.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate cash, you can always donate hair. Pantene Beautiful Lengths program requires 8 inches of hair, so this is another way to help a great cause. If you can't donate either of these items, you can still share this fundraiser and help spread the word to others who may want to participate. Thank you so much in advance.

story:
Baby Valentine 

Baby Valentine was born on the 9th Febuary 2014 and thrown into a pit latrine by a person believed to be her mother.  She suffered sepsis and lung damage as a result of inhaling human waste. After two and a half weeks in hospital she joined our big family at Zaidi ya Dreams a children's home for abused and abandoned children in Kenya. I started in 2013 and have 17 children in my care. Facebook.com/zaidiyadreams

After two weeks Valentine became ill and was taken to a private hospital since public hospitals are over crowded and under staffed, Death rates are high and care unpredictable. She was well when she arrived but with in an hour of her arrival she was in a serious condition with very low oxygen saturation. She was taken to ICU where she was diagnosed with aspiration phenomena and later bronchitis. Some doctors felt that it was linked to the pit latrine while some felt that the early damage to her lungs left her with little defences. By early morning she was placed on a respirator to allow her little body to survive while she recovered. She stayed in ICU for four days and a following three days in the wards.  With a bill of over $6000 we arranged transfer as soon as she was stable and seen as out of danger. The hospital refused to release her without payment. Having paid a hospital bill for another child for $3000 two weeks before we were unable to pay even a small amount of the bill. They eventually agreed to release her on the condition that i leave the ownership documents of my car with the hospital. She was taken to the hospital where she was first admited when rescued as they had agreed to treat her for free. After three days she became worse with a sudden drop in Oxygen saturation despite being on constant oxygen. We requested a doctor but non came. She was put on a mask and bag which we had been told she couldn't leave ICU while on. We insister on a doctor but after four hours she had not appeared and our requests to know when she would come went unanswered. An emergency doctor came to reaffix her line. He said she needed to be in ICU but her was unable to do the transfer until the doctor had come. He insisted he would get her doctor to come straight away. After two hours She still had not come. I went on three occasions to find the emergency doctor but found three patients waiting in emergency and  no one knew where the doctor was. At this point i decided to have her transferred to another hospital. I found out then that the Ambulance was broken. I asked the nurse what would happen if she got worse and needed a respirator, she told me 'We just have faith that, that wont happen'. Eight hours after her Oxygen levels crashed we left the hospital by private ambulance (it took an hour to come). At 3am we arrived at a mission hospital an hour out of town. She received very good care   there and is continuing to improve. They do not have enough oxygen monitors to go around but the nurses are doing a great job.  To date efforts to remove her from oxygen have failed. We have not been given a bill for the last hospital yet but we believe it will not be too high. 

What We Need 

  • We need $6058 to pay the bill. We need the car to transport the children to hospital, church and other outings. Failure to pay would result in the children's home being shut down and according to the hospital possible criminal charges agains myself. 

The Impact

Children's homes in kenya are often over crowded and corrupt leading to horrid conditions for children. Our home is different. We offer the children a fun and interactive environment with lots of messy play, music and sports to help them recover from trauma and thrive. We are admitting 20 children and growing with them into adulthood with the aim that every child undertake tertiary education. 

Without support we can not continue.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Please help get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Share on Social media.

story:
Why?

Chiapas is home to one of the largest indigenous populations in Mexico, primarily of Mayan descent. This region has a powerful,  500-year history of struggle for indigenous rights and dignity that continues today.

The state of Chiapas has minimal healthcare infrastructure, and the government clinics that do exist have a history of poor care, discrimination and outright hostility towards the Mayan communities.

To address this healthcare gap, a group of indigenous community health workers has opened their own clinic, located in the central plateau of Chiapas. The clinic is known as Sve’ic, or “The Wind’s Path” translated from their Mayan language. Advanced health workers provide essential services such as midwifery, gynecology, herbal medicine and dental care. The clinic trains community health workers who can provide health education and attend to basic health concerns thereby extending the clinic’s impact into more distant communities that lack other healthcare options.  An important part of their work includes acting as patient advocates for community members negotiating the medical system.

Currently, twenty new community health workers are completing their first year of training, three of whom are being trained as midwives. Their goal is to provide more specialized training to these twenty people and, in January, begin training a new group of community health workers to meet the continuing need for dignified and vital care.

What we are fundraising for:

We will be heading to Chiapas this winter to support their work by offering trainings in women's reproductive health, and we hope to bring as much medical equipment and supplies as possible, including a microscope. 

A private donor has already contributed $1500 towards this effort.  We are hoping to match that, and then some!  Funds raised will help defray travel costs and cover training and clinic supplies.

Future fundraising will go towards supporting other health care practitioners to visit the clinic to offer further training.

Who we are:

Lisa Sanderson-Fox is a health educator and licensed midwife with a background in herbal medicine. She has spent time working at an integrative clinic in New Mexico, offering prenatal care and sexual/ reproductive health consults to Spanish speaking recent immigrants. She was also a Breast and Cervical Cancer Prevention (BCC) provider. She got her start in healthcare many years ago working as a volunteer medic at the Berkeley Free Clinic, which has informed and inspired her work to this day. One of her current projects is offering workshops on the latest information about HPV.

Leslie Fiedler has a background in public health and health education with a focus in women’s reproductive and sexual health.  For the past 7 years, she has pursued this passion as a member of a feminist health collective in Chicago, where she currently works as director of clinical services, coordinating gynecology and complementary health services.  She also has a background in herbal medicine and is a licensed massage therapist.  As a member of a Chicago-based Healing Justice Network, she collaborates with other practitioners to build multidisciplinary and integrative approaches to health and wellness care embedded in a social justice framework. 

Lisa and Leslie have been working in solidarity with community health workers in Chiapas for more than a decade. After four years of living in Chiapas to do this work, they have continued to offer support from afar, traveling to Chiapas as often as possible to provide trainings and bring medical supplies.  These efforts have included sending local midwives and health workers to an international midwifery conference, giving more intensive trainings with advanced health workers, basic training for new health workers, clinic accompaniment, and facilitating community conversations on reproductive and sexual health. They are committed to helping these communities acquire the skills and resources needed to provide indispensable, preventive healthcare.

Other ways you can help:

Please help us spread the word – send an email or post on your favorite social media sites.

If you have access to medical equipment to donate, we’d love to talk! 

If you want to make a donation by check or an alternative arrangement, feel free to contact either Lisa or Leslie directly.   Or contact us at ChiapasClinicProject@gmail.com.  THANK YOU!

story:
COHO just featured on designboom

designboom is the first and most popular digital magazine for architecture & design culture. 

Targeting copper in cancer therapy: 'Copper That Cancer' | US National Library of MedicineNational Institutes of Health

Copper is Key in Burning Fat | Berkeley Lab

COPPER: An antioxidant essential to a healthy body | For Dummies

Antimicrobial applications of copper | sciencedirect.com

 

10 benefits of drinking water from a copper vessel | msn

12 reasons drinking water in copper vessel is beneficial | thehealthsite

10 Reasons Why You Should Drink Water From A Copper Pot​ |stylecraze

12 Amazing Healing Benefits of Drinking Water in a Copper Vessel​ | food.ndtv

6 REASONS TO TRY A COPPER WATER VESSEL​ | yogadigest

9 Health Benefits Of Drinking Water From A Copper Cup​ | boldsky

Why You Should Drink Water From A Copper Vessel​ | curejoy

Drink Water Stored in a Copper Vessel to Reap Numerous Health Benefits​ | top10homeremedies

Storing Drinking-water in Copper pots Kills Contaminating Diarrhoeagenic Bacteria | ncbi.nlm.nih

The Healing Properties of Water Stored in Copper | FractalEnlightenment.com

This Is Why You Should Use COHO...

18 reasons to drink water in copper cup

Here are some websites talking about benefits of drinking water in copper cup.

,

Here are some videos talking about benefits of copper.

 

You liked our project but right now you can not back us.

No problem. Just please share us with your  friends.

Thank you : )

 

We believe in the nature and its magic. We believe in simplicity and purity. 

That is why Coho is designed totally natural materials and in a way that it can be handmade by employing The principles of minimum material usage and maximum energy savings.

 

 

We worked to reach the most functional outcome within the shortest production duration and minimal materials.

We love the nature and we want to save it. We produce COHO with only reusable materials.

We have done many tests, searched for the most compatible materials and tried many designs. 

 

We made holes in wood and replaced the leather belt in one touch.

While combining the leather and wood we did not use ant extra materials such as Nail, snaps or screws...

We shorthened the brim of the lid so that it doesn't contact with any surface and stays hygenic.

And we trusted the production process to the masters...

 

 

 

You liked our project but right now you can not back us.

No problem. Just please share us with your  friends.

Thank you : )

 

 Use And Care Instructions

- Please read these instructions carefully to obtain the best results from COHO.
- Please retain these “USE AND CARE INSTRUCTIONS” for future reference.

Care Instructions For Your COHO

- Do not use your copperware in dishwasher.
- Do not use your copperware in microwave.
- Do not use metal utensils on the tin-lined surface.
- The use of scouring pads, steel wool, abrasive cleansers, bleach and/or oven cleaners is not recommended and can damage your copperware.
- Bleach will erode the material and should not be used on COHO.
- Acidic substances may react with your copper product. Do not use untinned products with acidic substances.

Caution

Please do not use the product to store the water but use it for your daily, active drinking ocasions. It is not recommended that water is stored in the product for long term.

Cleaning Your COHO

- Hand washing is strongly recommended. For regular care, clean your copperware with hot water, liquid detergent and a sponge. Scouring powder, scouring pads or harsh detergents are not recommended
- Do not use steel wool, scouring pads or harsh detergents. Nylon scrubbing pads are safe. It is best to use warm water and a mild detergent. 
- Do not clean COHO in dishwasher.
- Never use bleach or chlorine based products on COHO, even when diluted.
- In order to prevent water spotting, rinse in hot water and dry immediately after washing.

-  The brightness of the product might decrease with time and there might be local darkening... You can easily remove the stains with using metal shiner.

Part 2 - Maxfit 3rd Party Review           Part 3 - MAXFIT 3rd Party Review 

 Part 4 - MAXFIT 3rd Party Review        Part 5 - MAXFIT 3rd Party Review 

 Part 7 - MAXFIT 3rd Party Review        Part 8 - MAXFIT 3rd Party Review 

 Part 9 - MAXFIT 3rd Party Review      Part 10 - MAXFIT 3rd Party Review 

Part 11 - MAXFIT 3rd Party Review      Part 12 - MAXFIT 3rd Party Review 

 

 

 

At MaxFit we care about creating innovative health and fitness solutions that improve the well-being of all people through a fun fitness experience.  We believe in a holistic fitness experience that encompasses smart fitness, good nutrition, and positive mind health.  The MaxFit is a connected fitness platform that connects to a smartphone or tablet and allows people of all ages and all fitness levels, from the elite athlete to the fitness newbie to assess, plan, motivate, improve and reach their fitness goals through built-in professional training programs, powered by sophisticated algorithms, that customize workout plans for each individuals needs.

As a company it is important to us not only to provide a great product that our customers will love, and will help them live a healthier lifestyle, but also to create a company that our employees love to be a part of, and a company that helps to improve it's local communities, and to be a general force for good in this world.

story:
Semaine is a plant-based, anti-inflammatory supplement for the week of your period, created by a biologist and tested by the company's co-founders.

Cath and I started Semaine because we've had painful periods since we were teenagers. After years of taking over-the-counter pain meds, we were tired of the side effects and were looking for something that addressed the root problem of our pain. And we're not alone:

Cath and I started testing Semaine ingredients on ourselves nearly two years ago to get the exact combination of plant-powered ingredients that helped ease our period and endometriosis pain. When Semaine helped me get through my period pain free, we wanted to make sure it helped other women too.

Earlier this year, we asked 10 women to test Semaine by comparing a period without Semaine and a period with Semaine (filling out a detailed survey after each). These are the results:

 

Semaine was formulated by Lauren's husband Matt, while working in the University of Washington's Medical School. Based on extensive research on our immune response and our periods, Semaine directly targets the inflammation that spikes during our menstrual cycles.

What do your immune response and inflammation have to do with your period? Your immune system responds to your natural cycle. It's suppressed during ovulation and then comes roaring back when your period is about to start. People with more period pain tend to have a stronger immune response, and this means more inflammation:

 

Semaine is formulated with the perfect blend of nine super-powered plant extracts that work together to restore balance to your body. Your body is a complex system, and the inflammation that increases during your period is the result of interconnected cascades, not just a single change. Instead of reducing pain by sledgehammering a single pathway (like you can do with pharmaceuticals), Semaine uses multiple plant extracts that have been shown to affect distinct pathways. By using the synergies that come from combining plant-based extracts, Semaine helps you feel better than if you just took megadoses of a single ingredient.

Semaine’s formulation is the result of more than a year of intense research and testing. To decide what biological pathways we wanted to address, we pored over hundreds of scientific papers on period pain and the connections between IBS (Irritable Bowel Syndrome), inflammation, and pain. Then we researched dozens of different plant extracts, vitamins, and minerals to determine which had strong scientific evidence for specific mechanisms of action and also analyzed the quality of their clinical or pre-clinical trial data. Then we narrowed the list to select supplements that could work synergistically with one another. 

Each ingredient has been expertly sourced so that it's the highest quality, most bio-available form for your body. Not all supplement ingredients are created equal, and we wanted to make sure that not only was the supply chain fully transparent, and our ingredients rigorously and repeatedly tested for purity, but that your body absorbs the supplements as much as possible. So, not only do we use the world’s first vegan vitamin D3, but we rely heavily on phytosome technology. Phytosomes encapsulate supplements in sunflower lipids and are up to 30 times more bioavailable to your body—making sure your body gets the support it needs.

For a detailed list of the science and clinical trials behind each ingredient, please visit our FAQ page.

Semaine (which means "week" in French) is for the week of your period. We know everyone's period is different, but long or short, on hormonal birth control or not, Semaine works best when it's taken a few days before the start of your first full day of bleeding. This allows the anti-inflammatory ingredients to do their work before the worst of your inflammation starts.

Take two pills in the morning (with or without food) and two pills in the evening. Do this for seven days once a month, or whenever you have your period.

We exhaustively searched through hundreds of suppliers to make sure we could find those that passed our exacting quality, sustainability, and transparency standards. We wanted to make sure that not only could we track the supply chain the whole way, but also make sure suppliers use rigorous testing methods to ensure purity. We're grounded in science, and we only want to partner and source from companies that have similarly rigorous standards. For example, we use the world's first vegan vitamin D3 and use innovative approaches to make sure our supplements are maximally bioavailable (i.e., your body can absorb them). By joining extracts with sunflower lipids, the phytosome supplements we use are absorbed up to 30 times better than the raw ingredients.

The suppliers who meet our standards also tend to protect their reputation by branding their ingredients. Because of this, we only use “branded” ingredients. This is our list of “branded” ingredients: Sensoril® ashwagandha, Casperome® boswellia, Meriva® curcumin, Green Select® phytosome, Sucrosomial® magnesium, Quercefit® quercetin, Rexatrol® resveratrol, Siliphos® silymarin, Vitashine™ vegan vitamin D3.

Semaine was co-founded by us: Lar (center), Cath (right), and Matt (left). Cath and I have had painful periods since we were teenagers, and we later found out we had endometriosis. Whenever we met with doctors and other health practitioners, we weren't given a lot of options to combat our pain. After navigating the confusing and frequently unhelpful medical world, Cath and I wanted to better understand the science behind our period pain and how we could take action ourselves. There are many different ways (biological pathways) that can increase inflammation that have been linked to period pain and endometriosis. By specifically choosing supplements studied to affect these different biological pathways, we were able to dramatically lower our own pain, and as more and more of our friends expressed interest, we realized Semaine could help other women as well.

Why are we crowdfunding? We’ve been carefully sourcing, testing, and refining Semaine over the past two years. But in order to go into full production and make a consistent product, we have to order a lot more ingredients, use an FDA registered facility for capsule manufacturing, and produce thousands of bottles. It's only by scaling up production dramatically that it will be possible to sell Semaine with these prices.

We've worked out all the agreements, finalized the manufacturing timeline, and placed significant orders. We've committed our savings to covering the majority of the costs, but this crowdfunding is critical to cover the last bit of production costs. 

We promise our unrelenting commitment, passion, and care to ensuring you are excited to be part of the Semaine family. If for any reason you are dissatisfied, reach out to us within 30 days of receiving Semaine and we promise to take care of it. Semaine has changed our lives and we want it to change yours too.

When we first took Semaine, it empowered us and changed how we felt about our own periods. We know that there are millions like us who have struggled each month, unable to find solutions—all because women’s pain is still overlooked. On average, women lose about nine days of productivity each year from period pain, and that means that there are women and girls who are unable to live up to their potential because we have to fight through a haze of pain every month.

By funding Semaine, you’re helping us build a new and different future where that isn’t the standard. A future where women are believed, our pain isn’t ignored, and our diseases are actually studied. Thank you for helping us build a better world. 

Periods are normal. Pain shouldn’t be.
story_txt:
Semaine is a plant-based, anti-inflammatory supplement for the week of your period, created by a biologist and tested by the company's co-founders.

Cath and I started Semaine because we've had painful periods since we were teenagers. After years of taking over-the-counter pain meds, we were tired of the side effects and were looking for something that addressed the root problem of our pain. And we're not alone:


Cath and I started testing Semaine ingredients on ourselves nearly two years ago to get the exact combination of plant-powered ingredients that helped ease our period and endometriosis pain. When Semaine helped me get through my period pain free, we wanted to make sure it helped other women too.
Earlier this year, we asked 10 women to test Semaine by comparing a period without Semaine and a period with Semaine (filling out a detailed survey after each). These are the results:

 

Semaine was formulated by Lauren's husband Matt, while working in the University of Washington's Medical School. Based on extensive research on our immune response and our periods, Semaine directly targets the inflammation that spikes during our menstrual cycles.
What do your immune response and inflammation have to do with your period? Your immune system responds to your natural cycle. It's suppressed during ovulation and then comes roaring back when your period is about to start. People with more period pain tend to have a stronger immune response, and this means more inflammation:

 

Semaine is formulated with the perfect blend of nine super-powered plant extracts that work together to restore balance to your body. Your body is a complex system, and the inflammation that increases during your period is the result of interconnected cascades, not just a single change. Instead of reducing pain by sledgehammering a single pathway (like you can do with pharmaceuticals), Semaine uses multiple plant extracts that have been shown to affect distinct pathways. By using the synergies that come from combining plant-based extracts, Semaine helps you feel better than if you just took megadoses of a single ingredient.

Semaine’s formulation is the result of more than a year of intense research and testing. To decide what biological pathways we wanted to address, we pored over hundreds of scientific papers on period pain and the connections between IBS (Irritable Bowel Syndrome), inflammation, and pain. Then we researched dozens of different plant extracts, vitamins, and minerals to determine which had strong scientific evidence for specific mechanisms of action and also analyzed the quality of their clinical or pre-clinical trial data. Then we narrowed the list to select supplements that could work synergistically with one another. 
Each ingredient has been expertly sourced so that it's the highest quality, most bio-available form for your body. Not all supplement ingredients are created equal, and we wanted to make sure that not only was the supply chain fully transparent, and our ingredients rigorously and repeatedly tested for purity, but that your body absorbs the supplements as much as possible. So, not only do we use the world’s first vegan vitamin D3, but we rely heavily on phytosome technology. Phytosomes encapsulate supplements in sunflower lipids and are up to 30 times more bioavailable to your body—making sure your body gets the support it needs.

For a detailed list of the science and clinical trials behind each ingredient, please visit our FAQ page.

Semaine (which means "week" in French) is for the week of your period. We know everyone's period is different, but long or short, on hormonal birth control or not, Semaine works best when it's taken a few days before the start of your first full day of bleeding. This allows the anti-inflammatory ingredients to do their work before the worst of your inflammation starts.
Take two pills in the morning (with or without food) and two pills in the evening. Do this for seven days once a month, or whenever you have your period.



We exhaustively searched through hundreds of suppliers to make sure we could find those that passed our exacting quality, sustainability, and transparency standards. We wanted to make sure that not only could we track the supply chain the whole way, but also make sure suppliers use rigorous testing methods to ensure purity. We're grounded in science, and we only want to partner and source from companies that have similarly rigorous standards. For example, we use the world's first vegan vitamin D3 and use innovative approaches to make sure our supplements are maximally bioavailable (i.e., your body can absorb them). By joining extracts with sunflower lipids, the phytosome supplements we use are absorbed up to 30 times better than the raw ingredients.
The suppliers who meet our standards also tend to protect their reputation by branding their ingredients. Because of this, we only use “branded” ingredients. This is our list of “branded” ingredients: Sensoril® ashwagandha, Casperome® boswellia, Meriva® curcumin, Green Select® phytosome, Sucrosomial® magnesium, Quercefit® quercetin, Rexatrol® resveratrol, Siliphos® silymarin, Vitashine™ vegan vitamin D3.


Semaine was co-founded by us: Lar (center), Cath (right), and Matt (left). Cath and I have had painful periods since we were teenagers, and we later found out we had endometriosis. Whenever we met with doctors and other health practitioners, we weren't given a lot of options to combat our pain. After navigating the confusing and frequently unhelpful medical world, Cath and I wanted to better understand the science behind our period pain and how we could take action ourselves. There are many different ways (biological pathways) that can increase inflammation that have been linked to period pain and endometriosis. By specifically choosing supplements studied to affect these different biological pathways, we were able to dramatically lower our own pain, and as more and more of our friends expressed interest, we realized Semaine could help other women as well.


Why are we crowdfunding? We’ve been carefully sourcing, testing, and refining Semaine over the past two years. But in order to go into full production and make a consistent product, we have to order a lot more ingredients, use an FDA registered facility for capsule manufacturing, and produce thousands of bottles. It's only by scaling up production dramatically that it will be possible to sell Semaine with these prices.
We've worked out all the agreements, finalized the manufacturing timeline, and placed significant orders. We've committed our savings to covering the majority of the costs, but this crowdfunding is critical to cover the last bit of production costs. 

We promise our unrelenting commitment, passion, and care to ensuring you are excited to be part of the Semaine family. If for any reason you are dissatisfied, reach out to us within 30 days of receiving Semaine and we promise to take care of it. Semaine has changed our lives and we want it to change yours too.

When we first took Semaine, it empowered us and changed how we felt about our own periods. We know that there are millions like us who have struggled each month, unable to find solutions—all because women’s pain is still overlooked. On average, women lose about nine days of productivity each year from period pain, and that means that there are women and girls who are unable to live up to their potential because we have to fight through a haze of pain every month.
By funding Semaine, you’re helping us build a new and different future where that isn’t the standard. A future where women are believed, our pain isn’t ignored, and our diseases are actually studied. Thank you for helping us build a better world. 
Periods are normal. Pain shouldn’t be.

story: In the wake of massive earthquake of 7.8 Richter scale that hit my home country Nepal on 25th April, 2015, I have set up a humanitarian relief fund to help people from Nuwakot district (lies 75 km away from Kathmandu). The death toll is expected to go up as dust settles after this devastation. Thousands have been injured, countless have lost homes. The survivors are in dire need of basic humanitarian help like food, tents and medicines. Please support this cause by donating any amount possible. The donation will go directly to the affected villages.
