Blackboxitup.com-Personalized Black Box Protection
Our service is being designed to help you survive an unfortunate event.  It's social networking with a purpose. One that supersedes just posting pictures of yourself in a silly hat (which you can also do, if you'd like to).  We’re designing and engineering a safe, secure place to discreetly deposit your most valuable photos, recipes, art and music projects, receipts, financial, medical records and other important documentation.
But it's not just for data storage.  You're encouraged to photograph or scan your valuable property for deposit into your personal black box.  You'll be prompted to identify and value each  item so that it can be added to your personal property inventory. You can also associate it with a receipt.  This can be completed in a day or gradually, over time.
After you've deposited your items, you can retrieve and reproduce hard copy images, reports and claims, at will, as the need arises. Your information will be availble to you on multiple computers, smart phones and other devices across multiple platforms. Our entire raison d'etre is survival, protection, and helping you, help your insurance company by establishing the essential elements of a sound proof of loss after a catastrophic event.
If you do suffer a loss Blackboxitup.com will come to your aid with a couple of simple steps:
A.) Simply pull up your electronic claim form and it'll prompt you through a checklist allowing you to choose items from your inventory.  Your information will be automatically formatted into a neatly summarized claim form, accompanied by photos, and receipts. 
B.) Next, just print your completed claim and email, fax, snail mail or hand deliver it to your Adjuster and they'll have the documentary evidence necessary to establish your proof of loss, which will help them adjust and pay your claim.
Depending on your insurance coverage, you can recover the reproduction costs of your documents and photos.  There's enough to worry about after a catastrophe, already. Let alone worrying about your stuff! If you don't Blackboxitup, you'll never be able to accomplish the extensive level of reproduction that will be needed, if all is lost.
This procedure can be used for other purposes, too, such as producing well supported banking, business and financial statements, creating your will, etc. There are countless possibilities and scenarios.  We're certain you'll think of more uses for these important tools as time goes on.  Blackboxitup.com will also help you stay in touch with your network and the community at large, across multiple platforms and integrated services as a central meeting location.  This would be beneficial for a planning a party, and crucial during a crisis. 
A mall area will be establish, too, where we'll feature all of the goods, gear & gadgetry.  This will include items like smart phones and accessories, scanniers, and computers.  Also, disaster supplies will be featured for your planning needs, along with weather and catastrophe specific updates at a glance.
About the Founder
First of all, I genuinely love people and having had extensive experience in public service as a government officer in various capacities, I continue to consider myself to be a humble public servant.
Additionally, I'm a consultant representing Fortune 500 companies, specializing in back bone infrastructure development.  Primarily, my responsibilities are in telecommunications, currently.  I also have a background in claims administration and amongst other business licenses, in multiple states, I'm a licensed Catastrophic Claims Adjuster.  Blackboxitup.com is a culmination of my diverse experiences as my team and I address preparedness planning as our pleasure in providing a critically needed public service.
Lemony Snickets - I've Personally Experienced A Series of Unfortunate, Catastrophic, Life-Altering Events!
I mentioned in the video describing this project that you may have a catastrophic event. Well, we never really seem to expect it to happen to us, I know first hand, because I didn't expect it either. But, I've had a number of experiences in life that I can only say, modified my existence on this planet. Here are a just a few: My vehicle was robbed, with 2 computers stolen alon with my family's passports, various, other important documents and thousands of irreplaceable photos & docs. on my hard drives.
A couple of years ago after a routine physical I was diagnosed with the 'Big C'. Fortunately for me I'm now a cancer SURVIVOR! Last year we experienced significant tornado and lightning damage and worst of all, this spring, my home was burglarized. Along with computers, the burglars stole my entire home study including every single personal photo, negative, video tape & DVD I owned. I now have no photos of my youth, wedding or my family remaining except those that were digitized and saved elsewhere!
What I miss most of all is seeing photos of my wife and I together when we were younger, as well as our children's baby pictures & loved ones who've since passed away. It hurts deeply to even mention these details. But, I now know resoundingly, that this could happen to anyone! After all, the disasters that we hear about in the media are happening to someone. At some point in the future that someone may well be you or me! Most of the people who experience disasters probably thought: 'it'll never happen to me', right before it actually did happen to them.
What was the Genesis of Blackboxitup.com?
As you might imagine, when I received a cancer diagnosis and chemotherapy beckoning me in my future, it also armed me with a bucket list. So, before I started chemo, I decided to leave the north country with my son and head back out to Moshav Beit Zayit by the Jerusalem Forest, where I spent time as a youth, because I wasn't sure if I could ever return there again and I wanted to go back at least one more time.
My son and I took fabulous photos there. So I started thinking to myself: 'I know, material things aren't the most important in the world, especially now...But if I had to chose some, which of them would be the most important to me?' Of course most things are replaceable, but important video memories and original documents often can't be reproduced. So I realizing that we're all in the same boat, I concluded that everyone needs black box protection. This was the seed of the idea. In the Hebrew language Genesis is Bereshit or looseley, "in the beginning", thus, in this way Blackboxitup.com was born.
Critical Conditions Hard To Deal With Worldwide
You can call it 'Global Warming', '2012', 'The End of the World', 'The Last Days of the System of Things', or like Michael Jackson said "blame it on the boogie!" But SOMETHING WEIRD IS GOING ON IN THE ENVIRONMENT NO MATTER HOW YOU SLICE IT!!! Whatever the reasons, our home, the earth, is experiencing an increasingly dramatic, catastrophic turn of events that are totally beyond our ability to control.
Plus, these things have been happening with seemingly greater frequency and intensity and in one place after the other, as if with birthing pains. Whether great earthquakes, epoch fires, large scale floods, super tornadoes, hurricanes, typhoons, cyclones, tsunamis, sink holes, and the list goes on!
How many years have we all heard that California is due for a major earthquake? Scientists have research that indicates the great earthquake will extend from Baja California, in Mexico, all of the way up north into the Bay area! Here's a test: take any of the disaster types mentioned above, perform a search on any given day and see where one of these events may be in progress right now. This makes it all the more imperative that we develop a diversity of personalized black box protection options.
Why is funding needed?
We need about $30,000.00 to complete our initial phase, substantially more will be needed to complete the next phases of our project. This is an active work in progress with a real budget and an active schedule. To date, our team is about one-third of the way towards completion, I've personally funded it thus far and come what may, I'll see it through to completion (remember my bucket list wishes and raison d'etre?). Having overcome cancer, I'm a real SURVIVOR, our team will get this project launched come heck or high water, quite possibly, literally speaking!
Our project addresses a critical need and we really want this to be a community effort from design to launch and beyond! We hope that by working together, we'll help the site become an integral part of our respective survival preparedness planning. Whereas there are destructive elements in this world that threaten our personal peace and security. So we welcome your support!
Engineering & Design Phases:
1.) The website and subject of this project is the Phase I.  We'll finalize, beta test and launch the fully operational website. Although, the basic framework has already been engineered, we can't convey any more vehemently that we're giving all supporters an opportunity to vocalize the features that you'd like to see incorporated into your personal black box. We'd like to include features that you'd enjoy most, so please share them with us while we're still in the first phase. Please use this opportunity to HAVE YOUR VOICE HEARD because we'll listen attentively to you!
2.) In Phase II, we're developing a full complement of smartphone applications. It's features will make it easy for you to take a photo, identify and assign a value or receipt to an item for your inventory list and deposit it into your personal black box.
3.) Phase III, may be the most exciting of all! In this phase we'll finalize the engineering of a physical personal black box which will be offered first to current members of Blackboxitup.com at the time of its release. It'll have some amazing features, which we look forward to sharing with you in the future!
Once Phase One has been accomplished, we'll keep you posted on the development of subsequent phases and again, incorporate your voice in future developments. We're very curious to hear what features you'd like to have in a physical black box of your very own!
We also welcome your personal support and request that you, please, share details with your friends, family and associates about our exciting projects on Facebook, Google, Twitter, Linkedin, etc.
Despite all of the challenges we all face, we're living an exciting time period for technological development! This is proven by the aforementioned sites who are doing a fabulous job in their respective niches! It's also time for Blackboxitup.com to take its place in our lives and help us through trying times. What an honor and privilege it would be to be mentioned in the same breath as the preceding operations at some time in the future.
As you lend your support to our project, we trust that you'll never, ever forget that you were right here with us at the beginning of it all. Furthermore, neither will we! Right now, time is of the essence in getting this project off the ground and WE THANK YOU, IN ADVANCE FOR YOUR TIME, CONSIDERATION AND SUPPORT!
The team at Blackboxitup.com

story:
Our Story

 InRecovery magazine will be a monthly publication serving the people who are both directly and indirectly involved in recovery from alcoholism and addiction in the Twin Cities. We aim to inform, entertain, and unite the many faces of addiction through one common ideal; a healthy recovery expressed through a sober lifestyle. Our publication will feature reader-submitted articles that describe the many faces and experiences in our recovery community, addiction related news and scientific studies, and a comprehensive directory of meetings and related events in the metro area.

Find a meeting. We provide an all inclusive directory to both the 12-step and non-12-step meetings available in the metro area. Meetings are sorted by type, time, and city to provide an easy-to-follow guide for readers. Whether our subscribers are looking for a meeting for themselves or someone else, we aim to provide easy-access to a wider range of options for our readers.

Have a voice. InRecovery magazine provides the people in our community with an opportunity to be heard. We believe that by contributing to the commuity, we become apart of the community. Our reader-submitted articles provide a safe and anonymous outlet for people to not only express their experiences and insights with the community, but to also help others while helping themselves.

Be connected. Whether you are in recovery or simply find the topic interesting, InRecovery magazine provides common ground for a diverse community of people to come together who may have otherwise never had. Our publication is a place for people to both share their experiences and broaden their awareness and understanding of addiction through our addiction related news and scientific studies. We believe that by expanding the recovery community, we connect more people within the community. And by connecting more people, we best create a magazine to inform, entertain, and engage our readers.


The Impact

This publication will create an interconnected support network spanning the Twin Cities.  InRecovery promotes feelings of purpose and give addicts a sense of self through giving them a platform to be heard.  It will significantly increase their access to the latest information and scientific studies about addiction (which affects all aspects of our societies across the world), and easy access to a much broader pool of support groups available at any time of the day.  Because a better informed recovery community is a healthier community, which affects all of society.  InRecovery aims to connect disjointed factions of recovery circles to establish a larger, healthy community in recovery to be used for a wider source of support.


What We Need & What You Get

All the costs associated with the website development and design are as follows:

 

Custom Interface Design: $300 (and up, depending on revisions)
Create html/css and create site template $120 (and up, depending on complexity)

Static Content:

 9 pages x $25 per page = $225
Create and style Simple Contact Form: $35
Home page slider: Resize and compress images*, create and style: $110 (and up depending on how many images and functionality required)
Home page with a variety of current content from various categories $70
Embed and style a mailing list signup form $45
Members-only content with login and registration: $70
Install and configure testimonial or quote rotator (up to 10 quotes): $70
Technical: Configure hosting, Install & configure wordpress, point domain, migrate site to live host to launch: $120
Configure SEO meta data for all pages** $5 per page = $45
Register XML sitemap with google, yahoo, Register with google analyics so you can track site stats $40
Changes: Proportional to scope of site. Total usually ends up being around $5 per page of content, depending on revisions and client needs $45
ADMIN STUFF:
Consulting, project management, tutorials, phone calls, etc:		 Proportional to scope of site. Usually ends up being around $10 per page of content, depending on revisions and client needs $90


Total cost for the website will be between $1200 and $1500.


We will additionally be spending $1000 on the ezine layout and design to be accessed via the website.  Both of these costs are modest when it comes to hiring a professional.  We will be hiring the design services from the Minneapolis College of Art and Design to give students the opportunity implement a real-world project.  Students are supervised by professionals to ensure the desired creative goal is reached.  Lastly, we will be spending $3000 on the initial promotional materials to get our name out there to make people aware of this as a valuable resource for addicts and alcoholics in recovery (ad space, flyers, banners, etc.)  All of the money donated will be applied and utilized toward establishing a better, more connected recovery community in the Twin Cities.  If you have experience, knowledge, or an interest in addiction, you will appreciate the value of implementing this publication as a resource.


What you get is, since we're as broke as Nancy Kerrigan's knee circa 1994, your name with the amount you contributed on our website and an automatic subscription to the magazine, and a whole bunch of fun stuff we can't really give you outlined in the perks!  


Other Ways You Can Help

Share this with your friends via Facebook, Twitter, email, telegraph, morse code, or two tin cans and string!  We would love to hear from you!  Whether you are as broke as us, we would very much appreciate a simple email about your thoughts or feelings on our cause regardless of whether you can contribute or not.  Encouragement and communication goes a long way, especially when dealing with addiction, and we would appreciate your input!

story:
Hi,

My name is Toni Causey and my Mom's name is Debbie Cox. She was diagnosed with Inflammatory Breast Cancer in February 2012. Inflammatory Breast Cancer is a very rare and aggressive form of Breast Cancer, only 1 to 5 percent of women in the United States are diagnosed with this form of cancer. Within one week of finding the lump it had grown into an 8 inch tumor. She has gone through 4 months of chemotherapy. She was supposed to have another 6 to 9 weeks of chemo to go, but she is doing badly with it, so they are stretching it out. Her red blood cell count, as well as her white blood count has dropped so low that she has already had to have a blood infusion. She was prescribed a walker with a seat and also a shower chair because she was too weak to walk or even take a shower without the shower chair.  After the chemo, she will have a mastectomy to remove the tumor. Following this surgery she will have radiation for an unknown period of time, followed by reconstructive surgery.

She has already encountered thousands of dollars in medical bills since February and there will be many more to come. This is going to be a very long process, and she needs any help she can get. All donations no matter the amount are greatly appreciated. They will all go towards medical bills. 

My Aunts Vicki and Terri and  also my Uncle David and cousin Brett all shaved their hair in support  of my Mom. The video of My Aunt Vicki is shown along with the story on this website. The others will be added soon.

You can visit the website at  www.indiegogo.com to see what the website is all about. If you are not comfortable donationg through this site you can also pay through paypal, that option is available when you click on contribute.  If you are able to help or would like to share this story with someone you might know that would be willing or able to help please do so. It would be truly appreciated. Thank you and may God bless you!!

 

I will be updating this as the treatments go along. I have added three updates under the update statusvery

Please read my latest update and and help before time runs out, I already owe $4800.00 just for the chemo.

Thank you very much.

story:
My name's Chase. I'm just a guy trying to help his family get by from day-to-day, but this campaign isn't about me. It's about my good friend Jamie.
 
Right now, Jamie lives in Tennessee, and is having a hard time finding work due to being stuck at home. She was helping her parents by taking care of her younger siblings, but that's changed. Right now, she's not needed in her house, and due to her parents' busy, conflicting schedules, she's unable to get out and even so much as get her driver's license. Even though her family doesn't treat her terribly, the environment is overall very negative for her, to the point that I've been concerned about her well-being, both mentally and physically.

So after a lot of thinking and discussing, we both decided it'd be best if she moved out of her family's home and moved back down to Florida to live with me and my family. However, there's a few things we need to try to take care of before she gets here, such as fixing our septic tank and making a few home repairs that would be best done before another person moves in.

Unfortunately, neither of us are holding a job at the moment, and while my family can easily help her get on her feet once she's here, we just can't save up quite enough to do this any time soon. That's why we need a little extra help to pull this off. Once Jamie gets here, I'll be able to teach her how to drive, and together we plan to go job hunting often.

This woman's been my best friend in the world since elementary school. I just want to help her get out from under her parents and into a different, more helpful and positive environment, and help give her a push to finally get moving in life.

What donations and any extra funds will go towards:
- Fixing the septic tank
- Carpeting and painting the room we're cleaning out for Jamie
- Picking up some extra things we need to prepare for another person (More towels, dishes, cooking utensils, etc)
- Buying a hitch to put on our car
- Paying for the trip to get her (Gas, renting a small U-haul trailer)


No matter what amount you decide to donate, every penny helps one way or another. If you can't donate, please help spread the word. My sincerest thanks to everyone that chooses to help us out in this situation.

story:
My name is Aimee and I am creating a campaign to try and help raise funds for my "brother from another mother", Sean Greene.  Sean is 23 years old and has been my younger brother's best friend since they were 5.  

Very early Sunday morning Sean was found face down in a ditch in San Luis Obispo.  He was rushed to the hospital where he had emergency brain surgery due to swelling.  No one is sure exactly how it happened.  He was riding his skateboard home after a party.  Sean is still in a coma at the moment and the Dr.'s are keeping a close eye on him as we all pray that he comes out of this and with no permanent damage.  

I decided to start a campaign because I know that no matter the outcome there is going to be a large financial burden on him and his family, and I want that to be the very least of their worries.  

Sean is such an incredible young man.  I have had the privilege of watching him grow up and was even his roommate for his first year of college.  He is a very quite, gentle soul.  All I can do is pray for him, can you please do the same?  I believe very strongly in the power of thought, and we need all the positive vibes we can get!  Thank you!

story: My teammate needs your help in getting him well on a long road to recovery after recently getting out of ICU. Any donations to help get him back on his feet would help out a lot.  I call Kris "smiley" because every time I see him with a patient he is always smiling and joking around with his patients to make them laugh and smile.  He brings a sweet spririt to our team and our place.  I want to keep Kris smiling as well by helping raise money will he is out of work.

story:
Saving My Son

I am on a mission to save my son from a terrible illness. However, it is not an illness that is easy to openly discuss.  Fighting against cancer is something you can reach out freely and ask for support from friends and family.  I am not minimizing that fight, but in the fight against mental illness you also have to fight the stigma and judgments. 

Mikel was abused and like many children he didn't tell anyone or ask for help.  As he grew up, he struggled with what had happened to him until he couldn't take it anymore and decided to take his life. That was 14 months ago.  He has made up his mind that he is "too damaged" to go on living and since then he has attempted suicide 4 other times. He has been diagnosed with PTSD and Depression. We have been told that he has Borderline Personality Disorder (BPD) tendencies, but cannot be diagnosed until after 18 (when development stops). Without the diagnosis insurance companies will not pay for many treatments or will only partially pay.

He looks at the struggle that lies in front of him and he simply feels that it is not worth it.  He has tried a number of outpatient treatments.  He feels that he has tried everything and feels little hope for a different future. I have spent thousands on trying to find him the help he needs to heal. The help he needs to rebuild his self-identity and replace negative coping skills with positive cognitive processes. We have made progress, but recently he was expelled from school for his impulsive lying.  The school requires him to complete an inpatient program before he can return.

As a mother, I am faced with the dilemma of sending my 14 year old, mentally ill child into a state mental health facility or into a dual diagnosis drug rehab.  If I can get any of them to work with me, as until he actually attempts suicide again or is in "crisis" they simply cannot help me.  DBT Inpatient treatment centers that help with Borderline Personality Disorder tendencies are few and far between and mostly cater to girls.  I found a treatment center that provides a small and safe group, but at this point I simply cannot afford it.

I know my timeline is not realistic to reach my goal, but I am desperate to get him the help he needs before it is too late.

Every dollar counts! The more people that contribute and promote this campaign the more it will be promoted on this site!

What We Need & What You Get

Here are the details:

  • My insurance will only cover 50% of the treatment at Paradigm Malibu -- the #1 adolescent treatment center for mental illness and substance abuse. The out of pocket cost is $24,500.00 for the treatment center.
  • The facility only works with 6 kids at a time and provides a unique treatment program to help kids with BPD and PTSD. The program is intense and is focused on solving the root cause of the behavior issues.
  • All funds that I raise will go to pay for this treatment or other treatment if I can't raise enough for Paradigm.
  • I will provide all contributors with a letter regarding Mikels progress and the impact of completing the program.

 

The Impact

Your contribution will only impact one person, but the impact will be truly life changing. Mikel deserves a chance to heal and live the life he was meant to live.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help by sharing this campaign with others!  You can also help by sharing your personal story of healing and hope with us.  Above all else, Mikel needs hope.

story:
#GivingTuesday 2014 Update:

We've launched our second crowdfunding campaign! Check out: Less Talk. Less Talk. More Action! for World-Class Care and Cutting Edge Parkinson's Disease Research. Join us and take action today.


$554,061...incredible! We thank you from the bottom of our hearts for your friendship, partnership, and support. Although our Indiegogo campaign has come to an end, it's never too late to invest in today, tomorrow, and hope at your Parkinson's Institute and Clinical Center. Every dollar makes a difference. We're in this together! Learn more: www.ThePI.org/Donate.

Bill Draper, Tim Draper, Polly Draper, Jesse Draper, Becky Draper, and the entire Draper family, want YOU to get your Indiegogo on.

Between now and Friday, February 28, 2014, you'll get to know the Parkinson's Institute and Clinical Center, and the impact of your contributions, through the personal Parkinson's journey of each generation of the Draper family. We know all too well that when a loved one is living with Parkinson’s disease, the entire family is living with Parkinson’s. Our story is told most meaningfully and powerfully through the personal journeys of our Parkinson’s Institute partners and their families—like Bill, Tim, Polly, Jesse, Becky, their family—and yours. We recognize and celebrate the Draper family’s courage. And, we asked them to share their story with the world. Together, we hope to inspire and motivate other families touched by Parkinson's disease and unleash a very personal call to action.




Caring for people with a disease as complex as Parkinson's does not fit neatly into today's healthcare economics.

It takes much more than an assembly line approach and a 15 minute consultation to provide appropriate and impactful care. Your contributions ensure that at the Parkinson's Institute and Clinical Center no sacrifice is made and no corner is cut.

How quickly do we want access to new and better treatments? How badly do we crave discoveries that one day, hopefully, will lead us to a cure?

Government and foundation research grants only cover a modest portion of the expenses associated with the remarkable science conducted at the Parkinson's Institute and Clinical Center. Philanthropy drives the pace at which our Laboratory and Clinical Researchers are able to pursue their work.

We bring together the brightest minds, the most competent hands, and the most compassionate hearts to provide the best Parkinson's disease care anywhere.

Two and a half decades ago a dedicated group of Parkinson's disease experts set out to create a better way to research and provide care for Parkinson's.

We would go beyond your standard doctor-patient relationship. Patients would become partners in developing their care plans, improving their quality of life, and discovering new strategies to confront and manage their disease. Compassionate care would work hand in hand with cutting-edge research to seek answers, develop new therapies and treatments, and ultimately work toward a cure.

Our result was the Parkinson's Institute and Clinical Center. Along the way, we have built something that's thoroughly unique. Our Institute is a place where people living with Parkinson's can both pursue their care and play an important role in research that will undoubtedly continue to change the landscape of Parkinson's science and medicine. We've already made some giant leaps, but our work is far from finished.

We are America's only independent non-profit organization combining world-class care, laboratory research, and clinical research for Parkinson's disease under one roof. By virtue of our design, we are uniquely equipped to provide the very best care, accelerate promising science, and perhaps most important—integrate the two and everything in between. It's what we now call Our Virtuous Circle and you are at the center of all that we do.

Return on Investment

Only because of generous contributions from people like you were we able to accomplish the following last year: raise over $4.6 million in mission critical core funding; partner with nearly 3,000 people living with Parkinson's disease and their families to provide them with world-class and compassionate care; conduct 28 clinical trials helping to advance new treatments and better therapies; provide 400 unique learning opportunities, educational programs, and exercise classes at no or very low cost for people living with Parkinson's and their loved ones; and leverage and supplement 13 new research grants attracted by our best and brightest minds allowing the pursuit of promising science.

How You Can Get Your Indiegogo On

  • Contribute today. Give graciously, generously, and to the fullest extent that you can. Go beyond "giving back". Invest in today, tomorrow, and hope.
  • Make some noise! Ask your family, friends, and co-workers to help spread the word about our Parkinson's Institute campaign on Indiegogo. Check out Indiegogo's easy to use share tools above.
  • Stay connected. Check back often as our story and campaign unfolds! Connect with the Parkinson's Institute and Clinical Center through our Website, Facebook, Twitter, YouTube, and/or subscribe to our eNews.

We thank you from the bottom of our hearts!

Parkinson's. We're In This Together.

We thank you from the bottom of our hearts!

story:
Short Summary

About 40% of Americans use alternatives to drugs and surgery at some point, and most use Western medicine at the same time. Consumers have virtually no guidance about works the best, which sources of information to trust, how to find a 'good' provider, or how to get their own integrative health care team to work together as they try to improve and maintain their health.

HealthTeam360 is a product under development that will enable health consumers to get reliable, evidence-informed information regarding their options for integrative care and to purchase online personalized reviews of their interests to help set up your personal case management plan. These reviews will come from our core set of health providers: doctors of medicine, chiropractic and naturopathy; psychologists, providers of acupuncture and Oriental medicine and massage therapists.

What We Need & What You Get

We need $70K for the first phase of product development: to build a testable version of the site, database, to obtain and content and to work with a defined population to measure the economic impact of the program. If we fall short of this goal we'll do it in smaller steps as funding becomes available. Mobile and tablet-based versions of the site will be available, and apps for iPhone and Android will be developed.

Our funding opportunities range from being part of a feedback group on product development to receiving online personalized reviews of your health concerns from our clinical review panel.

We want to get people involved as supporters as well as funders, people who can give us feedback about the concept as we develop the product and publish news and information about how consumers can--and need to--become their own informed case managers as health care reform continues to mature.

The Impact

We expect it will save individuals, employers, and health systems money. We expect it will foster collaboration among providers and produce better outcomes at lower overall costs. We expect it will help healthcare consumers become more effective at managing their own care (can we find a new word to replace "empowered," please?).

Our leadership and clinical advisors have been working in their respective professions and in integrative health care for decades. Many have been part of experiments (failures and successes) in integrative health care team delivery. We have solid grounding in product and business development and in the 'system side' of health care. We have a lot of experience evaluating evidence and applying it to making clinical decisions. We've piloted the concept with a small population to examine the utility of the process and the impact multidisciplinary reviews have on the type of care being delivered. We'll acquire the talents we need (and don't have) to help ensure we stay on target and focus on our goals. As we learned working at a large health plan in product development, we want to start small and build fast!

We know we can make an important difference with this product.

Other Ways You Can Help

We really REALLY need help promoting awareness of this opportunity, so if you can share this information and raise awareness about the project, please do so!

For more information, please go to HealthTeam360.com and 'like' us on Facebook!

story:
.

My moma Shela was the joy of our lives, always happy and laughing about something. She was a true friend and the best mother I could have ever asked for. It is hard for me to even think about going on without her. I ask that you continue to pray for me and my family. Thank you for your support in what I consider the worse days of my life...I will close with what my moma would say....

 

Smooches!

story:
Hello,
My name is Tamara, I'm Uwe's mother and she has three brothers and three sisters, I'm a single mother raising my seven children to be loving successful people.
 My campaign is very important to me because Uwe was burned at the age of one.  We had a house fire and Uwe was the only one of my kids that I couldn't find due to her being where the fire started.   For a very long time I had no idea how to clear her skin of scars.   We have come along way with God's help and our faith.  We have been to so many doctors and have searched the internet for solutions and always came up empty handed.  But I found a doctor, Dr. Jill S. Waibel, M.D. in Miami, Florida that can help with Uwe's scars.
Uwe had to get skin grafts, so they had to cut her skin.  Well, a lot of times when you cut on someone's skin it keloids, Dr. Jill Waibel  has successfully developed industry leading procedures and techniques for treating the scars of burn survivors.
 Uwe is such an awesome child and she had an unfair start to her childhood.  No matter what, Uwe always has a smile on her face and is more than willing to do her very best at anything that is handed to her.
Uwe is such a sweet person no matter what, I can just imagine with treatments to help her feel more comfortable about herself would really bring her greatness out more.  Its very easy to say keep your head up ,don't worry what people say about you, but I don't live her life day by day.   I  have some idea what she goes through because I'm with her a lot and I see the stares and hear the comments, but it really hurts her feelings and mine as well.  But I will never truly understand her journey.  I can only figure out ways to make it enjoyable.
We live in Oklahoma and Dr. Jill Waibel's treatment center is in Florida.   We will have to travel back and fourth by plane and have to stay overnight to make sure she doesn't have a reaction. The treatments vary and the parts of her body treated will be small at each session.   The doctor is not sure how many treatments will be needed per body part. 
Uwe was  burned 45% over her body and has third degree burns. The parts that need the treatments are her face, back, chest ,arms, hands, shoulders and both outer thighs. Its a total of two hours for each treatment and every eight weeks Uwe can go back and get more treatments. Uwe will also need reconstructive surgery after the treatments.  Although we have insurance,  the insurance company considers these treatments as cosmetic  and will not cover them.  Due to the amount of areas that need to be treated we decided to raise the money
 
Each treatment per area not including how many treatments needed per area. These are the prices for one treatment only for a small area.
1. Face-$800-$1200
2. Chest-$800-$1200
3. Back - $1200-$1500
4. Arms-$400-$700 each
5. Thigh-$600-$800 each
6. Hands-$300 each
Each round trip will vary for two people from Oklahoma City to Miami, Fla from $300 to $400 each (which I can schedule a week in advance to get that price),  Cheapest hotel with shuttle to the hospital, so I don't have to get a rental car is $150 for the night.  She will also have to get reconstruction surgery on her hand, under her arm, because she is growing and it continues to tear and her chest. This will cost anywhere from $8 to $24 thousand per area.  We have hopes though to find someone that will do it cheaper along our journey.
 

UWE'S WORDS

Its a little hard but not
entirely.   I had to go through some bumps in the road.  Like not
liking the way I look, thinking that no one would want to be my
friend or not getting a boyfriend.  I was focused on myself feeling
bad for me when there are other people who have it worse than me.  I
was in a bulling situation and I would feel sorry for myself.  My
family and I kept going to church every Sunday and Wednesday but
sometime I wouldn't pay attention, because I thought I didn't have
to be there.  But as I got older my life was getting harder so I was
listening to what my pastor was preaching in church.   He was talking
about you are not alone, as long as we have the glory of God. I used
to think that I didn't have anybody to talk to but I started 
reading the Bible and joining the clubs at church.  I was not being
the quiet one.  It is a little easier but I have to still deal with
people staring at me. 

I am glad I choose to listen to my pastor and read my bible.                                                It changed me a lot and made me realize that I not the only person in the world going through things in my life.  I was lucky to have a chance to learn Gods word,
because some people do not have that chance.  With all those years of
learning Gods word and going to church It made me more open to try
new things.   Last year I went to a church called Cross Timber that is
where I got saved at.  I was eleven at the time and that following
Sunday I was baptized.   It changed my life.   I don't know how to
explain it but it just made me feel better about who I am. 

So let me tell you about the body that I live in. My skin makes my life physically hard
because I cant move certain parts of my body due to my shin is so
tight. My skin is stopping me from following my dreams to be a
professional dancer.  A dancer has to move a lot so my skin keeps me
from moving around.  My hand cant stretch out all the way which makes
it hard to do flips.  I cant move my arm certain ways either because
under my arm pit the skin is very tight and cracks and bleeds.  When I
see myself in the mirror it makes me cry because I don't look like
everybody else.  People judge me before they get to know me.  I
have other dreams like getting treatments to help me, I want to get
married one day and have children like everyone else.  I have dreams
like you have dreams. 

Thank you for all you help.

I used	to think that I didn't have anybody to talk to but I started 	reading the Bible and joining the clubs at church.  I was not being	the quiet one.  It is a little easier but I have to still deal with	people staring at me. 
I am glad I choose to listen to my pastor and read my bible.                                                It changed me a lot and made me realize that I not the only person in the world going through things in my life.  I was lucky to have a chance to learn Gods word,	because some people do not have that chance.  With all those years of	learning Gods word and going to church It made me more open to try	new things.   Last year I went to a church called Cross Timber that is	where I got saved at.  I was eleven at the time and that following	Sunday I was baptized.   It changed my life.   I don't know how to	explain it but it just made me feel better about who I am. 
So let me tell you about the body that I live in. My skin makes my life physically hard	because I cant move certain parts of my body due to my shin is so	tight. My skin is stopping me from following my dreams to be a	professional dancer.  A dancer has to move a lot so my skin keeps me	from moving around.  My hand cant stretch out all the way which makes	it hard to do flips.  I cant move my arm certain ways either because	under my arm pit the skin is very tight and cracks and bleeds.  When I	see myself in the mirror it makes me cry because I don't look like	everybody else.  People judge me before they get to know me.  I	have other dreams like getting treatments to help me, I want to get	married one day and have children like everyone else.  I have dreams	like you have dreams. 
Thank you for all you help.

story:
Our Story

My name is Elma Flores, my mom is Hilda Rodriguez she was born on September 16, 1953 born and raised in Monterrey, Mexico grew up with four brothers and three sisters, she was the youngest among the sisters. She was the first in her family to go to College and get a career as a lawyer, though at that time it was considered of it being a male profession, she still conquered it. She wedded my father at 31 and had me at 32. When I was 4 my dad was offered a visa to come to the beautiful states. At 42 she had my sister Emily Flores who is now a senior and top 10% of her class, also an honor student all 4 years. My mom has been diagnosed with Cholesterol, and Diabetes before but she has controlled and overcame that. Now she has been diagnosed with a rare type of breast cancer and will be needing surgery and radiology.

We need your Support

Our mom left her career, and her home to follow the man she married for him to only be in and out of our lives and give her an unstable life. She currently works at a nursing home as a housekeeper, because of her language barrier since she never took time to learn it properly beacause she was busy raising us her daughters. I am now 27 and as much as I wish I was able to pay everything for her I am not able to because I now have a family and bills of my own. I am needing our friends, family, and community to please help us raise money to pay for my moms surgery which would cure her and save her life. She just celebrated her 60th birthday and I would love to have her many more years to come.

As a thank you, you will receieve a personalized thank you card and a breast cancer souvenir could be a pin, or pen.

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • You can still help by sharing my moms story and getting others to contribute we accept all major credit cards, debit cards, and paypal.

story:
Therapy for Chianna

I have been battling insurance companies trying to get therapy covered for our daughter, Chianna. She has Cerebral Palsy which has caused a weakness on her right  side. She needs speech, physical and occupational therapies to better her life. Her health insurance through the State of Florida does not have enough providers available, so she has been without all the necessary therapies since October of 2011. They have been giving me the run around for months, doing everything possible to make it impossible for me to have them approve her therapy. The video above is from May 2011 when she was getting regular therapies and shows the progress she was making gaining the use of ther right hand. If we made less money, she would qualify for a different insurance that covers the therapies and is more widely accepted. Although we make more than the limit, we do not make enough to cover the $1100 a month that her therapies cost without insurance.

Your Contributions

Your contributions to us will go directly to pay providers for her therapy.

The Impact

I know that we are not alone in this quest for proper health insurance. The United States is obviously having a health insurance crisis. No one monitors the insurance companies, and even though our insurance comes from the state of Florida, they seem to be using the same tactics we have experienced with other insurance companies: make it so hard to get coverage, people will not have time to deal with it, will give up, or die before they receive the treatment needed and the insurance company doesn't have to pay out anything.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Please share our story on your social media channels.
  • Contact your legilators about health care for children, especially those with special needs.

story:
[Your] Health Is Wealth Campaign

 

The Spark

 Funmilola Oladini is currently in her last year at Washington University in St. Louis. The [Your] Health Is Wealth campaign stemmed from an issue she noticed when visiting her home country of Nigeria last January. During her visit, she witnessed first-hand the rapid emergence of fast-food restaurants in Ibadan and Lagos. Seeing the rapid emergence of fast-food culture among middle class Nigerians, coupled with anecdotes about family friends who suddenly died from unknown illness (often later suspected to be type 2 diabetes or hypertension) sparked her interest in examining the relationship between emergence of fast food, urbanization, and chronic health disease in Nigeria. 

The Background

Diabetes and hypertension are rapidly emerging lifestyle-induced chronic diseases in sub-Saharan Africa. Prevalence of Type 2 Diabetes is as high as 11% in some urban areas in Nigeria. Even worse, the average life expectancy for someone with Type 2 diabetes in Nigeria is 8.8 years.  A recent study in a developing country has linked increased consumption of fast food to increased likelihood of diabetes. Several fast-food chains have recently established themselves in Nigeria and have been embraced by urban Nigerians who associate overeating with affluence. However, Nigeria lacks the healthcare resources needed to treat chronic disease resulting from poor diet since most health facilities are geared towards dealing with infectious disease. The current life expectancy in Nigeria is 51.9 years. This life expectancy is extremely disproportionate to its GDP, according to reports by the World Bank. 

The Location

Ibadan is the third largest metropolis in Nigeria, and has been inundated with fast-food restaurants. Urban, working people of the middle-class are currently at greater risk for type 2 diabetes as compared to rural, lower class people. Less than 50% of people in sub-Saharan Africa with diabetes are aware that they have the disease, and do not know the causes and symptoms of diabetes. The Health Is Wealth team believes that increasing awareness through training community health advocates who will spread the knowledge within communities is the best way to encourage people to better their lifestyles.

The Plan

The Health Is Wealth campaign aims to increase awareness about the health detriments of fast food and sedentary lifestyle and engage Nigerians to take charge of their own health through primary prevention of chronic disease. We plan to train first year students at Adeleke University School of Public Health as community health advocates (CHAs) to promote type 2 diabetes/ hypertension prevention through lifestyle change. We will also train lay community members residing in urban Ibadan as CHAs. Once trained, the CHAs will target urban business offices to speak to workers about small steps for busy individuals to make that could greatly enhance their overall health. We will be using the community health advocate training curriculum developed by the CDC and adapting it to make it relevant for Nigerians. After training the CHAs, we plan to conduct a weekend of health seminars and health screenings. 

The Goal

Our goal is to train community health advocates and maintain the relationship with them as an inlet to urban communities over the years, and to see how the community health advocates are able to influence the health habits and diabetes/ hypertension awareness of community members they come in contact with.

 

Where do YOU come into play?

In order for people to be open to our health sessions on prevention, we must also have sufficient health screening materials to test for the various indicators of Type 2 Diabetes and hypertension. We also hope to have some anti-diabetes medication to give out to community members who present with serious cases of diabetes. 

Already, we have begun fundraising, but we still need more to cover the costs of cholesterol screening kits and transportation for the YHIW Planning Team. 

Each cholesterol testing kit costs about $9 on average, and we are hoping to provide health seminars and health screenings to at least 200 high-risk community members in Ibadan. It would lend so much more credibility to the campaign if we are not only educating about diabetes/ hypertension, but helping diagnose people who are at high-risk for Type 2 Diabetes.

 Finally, we would like to provide compensation for the 15 individuals who volunteer as community health advocates. We would like to disburse $50 compensation  to them over the course of 5 years to incentivize them to continue their work as community health advocates. They will spend their time conducting surveys and holding healthy lifestyle/diabetes prevention sessions in the community; thus, providing remuneration is a realistic way to keep the community health advocates engaged in the campaign.

 Thus, the total amount of funds we are trying to raise for the Health Is Wealth Campaign is $2,550.

Remember, your greatest wealth is health. But do feel free to use whatever wealth you may have to enhance the health of people in need!

Other Ways You Can Help

Follow us on Twitter at @YHIWCampaign

Subscribe to our blog at yhiwcampaign.tumblr.com

story:
My Size App (Version 3)

Hi, my name is Mike and I would like to create the ultimate Body Measurement app. 

"My Size - BMI, Weight & Body Measurement Tracker" - That's the full name for the application as it's listed on the Apple iOS App Store. 

I always wanted to create and release an app. I was determined to create something that was actually worthwhile, that I would use and could be useful for many others too. This was the main theme of the company 'Amplified Apps' - to create useful apps, not just for the sake of making apps, or even making money.

The idea I came up with was an app for entering and recording your body measurements and weight and seeing the changes over time. A few months later 'My Size' was born. I released a free and a paid version of the same app

Health & Fitness is a huge market and the app area is no exception. The first edition of My Size was very basic and created on a budget, the second and current version was a refresh with a slightly healthier budget and has been performing reasonably well considering the very minimal marketing. 

Achievements

My Size Lite, the very first version and my first ever app, was free and achieved a respectable 35,000 downloads in its final 12 months.

My Size (Version 2) is the updated, paid version, and received over 4,000 purchases in the last 6 months. 

Some recent reviews:

"Great application I'm working as a personal trainer its great savings weights and girth measurements. Simple to use."
"If you're a trainer this is a must have app..."
"Great app to track weight loss and inches!! So motivating to see the graph of inches lost..."
"Exactly what I wanted it has all the features I wanted. A place for weight, body measurements, and even a body fat & bmi calculator."

Now I feel it is time to take it to the next level.


The Vision

My Size currently allows users to create a simple profile and input basic body measurement details on a regular basis. This data is converted into a graph which give a visual indication of the changes over various time periods.


We would now like to add a bucketful of additional features, many based on user requests:

  • Android Version - Let's share the experience with more users
  • Enhanced Settings with colour theme choices
  • Passcode Lock - secure your private information
  • Multiple users - allow more users per app install. Possibly a paid add-on
  • More measurements, better for weight-trainers/bodybuilders
  • Before & After photo feature, track your visual progress
  • Goal/Target Feature - have something to work towards
  • Auto Body Fat calculator

The aim is to be a leader in Body Measurement applications. As I believe I have already demonstrated, My Size is not just an app, it's an ongoing,  project and will be worked on, bug-fixed and improved continually.


The Investment

This project would cost an estimated £5000 and this amount would be spent on Planning, Graphic Design, Programming and Marketing. 


Ways You Can Help

Other than your valuable pledges you can help this project by:

  • Sharing with your friends & family
  • Posting on forums, Health & Fitness sites
  • Shouting about it on Social Networks

story:
Nurses on a mission are a group of nursing faculty and students located in southern Indiana. We are joining the Foundation for Peace to provide nursing service and health promotion to the community of Santa Domingo, Dominican Republic. 

        Our motto is "learn in order to serve." We feel strongly as health care professionals that it is important to give back to those with limited access to health care. It is our goal to serve approximately 600 persons per day in the medical clinics.


                       Where is Dominican Republic?


        Poverty, poor living conditions, and high inequality of income distribution is a commonplace among the people of Dominican Republic. Unemployment is high as 14 percent and more than 40 percent live below the poverty line. 

        We are going to be working for a weeklong in a clinic to provide much needed medical care to many families. As you can imagine, a trip like this requires financial support from many. In order for our mission trip to be a success we need to raise money for medical, medications and hygiene supplies that we will be taking with us to help provide for these families

                       What We Need

The total for the trip will cost approximately $40,000.  Money donated will be spent on supplies, medications, and transportation. 

Medical supplies include

  • Bandages
  • Gloves
  • Alcohol / Betadine swabs
  • Dressings
Medications include

  • Vitamins
  • Antibiotics
  • Anti-parasitics
  • Pain medications
  • Topical creams
Hygiene supplies include

  • Soap
  • Shampoo / conditioner
  • Tooth brushes / tooth paste

Your contributions will help to alleviate health conditions and encourage personal growth in the community of Santa Domingo. If you would be able to support us, we would be so grateful. We are so thankful for this opportunity and hope you see the value in what we will be accomplishing.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Adam, I run a small event management company in Yorkshire and recently my dad and step-mum adopted two disabled/terminally ill children to prevent them being alone and left in the hospital to die, since coming home with them the little boy, Josh (Pictured) was given 6 months to live from birth but passed that mark and has been getting stronger, he is now three years old and still, to doctors amazement, battling on in life. 

 

Amanda, the little girl who was also adopted has been doing great and doesn't have a condition as serious as Josh's but she is still disabled.

What We Need

We want to take the two of them to Disneyland, this will give them some sort of freedom and a life of enjoyment whilst they are still here with us, we want to raise £2000 to pay for them both to go accompanied by their parents, obviously.

We will also be putting on live events to raise some of the cash and hopefully be able to pay for them to get there.

 

The Impact

This will have a huge impact on the two of their lives, they have a loving family and are finding every bit of strength they can to hold on and we think that both parents and children deserve a break to enjoy their time together.

Other Ways You Can Help

Just spread the word and give as little or as much as you can.

story:
Meet Neavey

Nee-Nee is a 14 year old girl who loves people - the sillier the better!  She is happiest when she's out in the world and interacting with others, whether that's going to school, taking a spin in the backyard swing, or trying out a new piece of equipment during physical therapy.  Unfortunately, her opportunities to engage in these types of activities are already limited by several factors, including a seizure disorder, spinal deformity, and severe developmental impairments leaving her with no receptive or expressive language, unable to care for herself in any way.  In the face of these challenges,  Keith and Kelly have worked relentlessly to give her a life worth living - keeping her happy and comfortable.

*Check out the Gallery tab to see more pics of Neavey in action!  

Even more great pics on Kelly and Keith's facebook pages:
Keith: https://www.facebook.com/keith.millner?fref=ts;
Kelly: https://www.facebook.com/kelly.m.millner?fref=ts

Neavey's Spine Saga

As Neavey's scoliosis and kyphosis (basically a front to back curve, creating a hump effect or hunchback) have worsened, Keith and Kelly have been faced with a tough decision. Without surgery, the curves in Neavey's spine could get so bad that they would threaten the functioning of her vital organs (heart and lungs in particular), and might be debilitating enough that her parents would no longer be able to care for her at home.  Without spinal surgery, Neavey's decline could be long, slow and painful.  While there are serious risks involved, especially given Neavey's other impairments, surgery may also give her many more years of greater comfort, helping her stay as strong, happy, healthy and engaged as possible, for as long as possible.

Having embarked on the lenghty, complicated, and emotional process involving two surgeries and Halo Traction over several months, Keith and Kelly are focusing all of their energy on caring for their sweet girl and making sure this process is as smooth and comfortable for her as it can be. 

*Read more details about the surgeries and the process on Neavey's blog: http://neavey.blogspot.com. 

How You Can Help

As you can imagine, this entire process will be taxing - emotionally, physically, and financially. But if you're reading this, you likely know a little (or a lot) about Kelly and Keith's selflessness and committment, not only to Neavey, but to their friends and loved-ones.  So I hope you'll be compelled to help in some way, no matter how small.  Any support will be so gratefully received.

Your help can come in the form of a financial contribution, a prayer, a hug, an encouraging word on Facebook or via text, or someone to talk to.  Money raised will help Kelly and Keith with their share of expenses for things like: hospital fees, specialized equipment,  home health assistance, travel/lodging, and any loss of income. 

If you'd rather not donate online and prefer to mail a check, please make it payable to Kelly Millner or Keith Millner or Neave Ittmann and mail to Melanie Glover at 9543 Weatherwood Dr., Houston, TX 77080.

Thank you for doing what you can to help ensure Keith and Kelly have the opportunity to be by Neavey's side throughout this process.
story_txt:
Meet Neavey
Nee-Nee is a 14 year old girl who loves people - the sillier the better!  She is happiest when she's out in the world and interacting with others, whether that's going to school, taking a spin in the backyard swing, or trying out a new piece of equipment during physical therapy.  Unfortunately, her opportunities to engage in these types of activities are already limited by several factors, including a seizure disorder, spinal deformity, and severe developmental impairments leaving her with no receptive or expressive language, unable to care for herself in any way.  In the face of these challenges,  Keith and Kelly have worked relentlessly to give her a life worth living - keeping her happy and comfortable.
*Check out the Gallery tab to see more pics of Neavey in action!  
Even more great pics on Kelly and Keith's facebook pages:Keith: https://www.facebook.com/keith.millner?fref=ts;Kelly: https://www.facebook.com/kelly.m.millner?fref=ts
Neavey's Spine Saga
As Neavey's scoliosis and kyphosis (basically a front to back curve, creating a hump effect or hunchback) have worsened, Keith and Kelly have been faced with a tough decision. Without surgery, the curves in Neavey's spine could get so bad that they would threaten the functioning of her vital organs (heart and lungs in particular), and might be debilitating enough that her parents would no longer be able to care for her at home.  Without spinal surgery, Neavey's decline could be long, slow and painful.  While there are serious risks involved, especially given Neavey's other impairments, surgery may also give her many more years of greater comfort, helping her stay as strong, happy, healthy and engaged as possible, for as long as possible.
Having embarked on the lenghty, complicated, and emotional process involving two surgeries and Halo Traction over several months, Keith and Kelly are focusing all of their energy on caring for their sweet girl and making sure this process is as smooth and comfortable for her as it can be. *Read more details about the surgeries and the process on Neavey's blog: http://neavey.blogspot.com. 


How You Can Help
As you can imagine, this entire process will be taxing - emotionally, physically, and financially. But if you're reading this, you likely know a little (or a lot) about Kelly and Keith's selflessness and committment, not only to Neavey, but to their friends and loved-ones.  So I hope you'll be compelled to help in some way, no matter how small.  Any support will be so gratefully received.
Your help can come in the form of a financial contribution, a prayer, a hug, an encouraging word on Facebook or via text, or someone to talk to.  Money raised will help Kelly and Keith with their share of expenses for things like: hospital fees, specialized equipment,  home health assistance, travel/lodging, and any loss of income. 
If you'd rather not donate online and prefer to mail a check, please make it payable to Kelly Millner or Keith Millner or Neave Ittmann and mail to Melanie Glover at 9543 Weatherwood Dr., Houston, TX 77080.
Thank you for doing what you can to help ensure Keith and Kelly have the opportunity to be by Neavey's side throughout this process.

story:
Bear Tracks Protein Bars were created with a Vision to provide the highest quality protein bar with the most nutrition and best flavor and texture possible. This Vision also required that they must be made from Organic Ingredients with NO GLUTEN, NO SOY and NO GMO. After a year of research and many many recipe tries, success was obtained with the creation of:

BLACK BEAR TRACKS PROTEIN BARS: Organic Dark Chocolate made from scratch as well having the best non-denatured, biologically active whey protein concentrate made form organic sweet whey. It also includes Organic Sunflower Butter, Organic Sunflower seeds, Organic Cranberries and Coconut, as well as Organic Hemp Seeds and Coconut Oil. EACH 2 OZ BAR CONTAINS 12 GRAMS OF PROTEIN

 

 

 

BROWN BEAR TRACKS PROTEIN BARS:  Same as Black Bear but as a Semi Sweet Chocolate with Organic Peanut Butter instead of sunflower seed butter.EACH 2 OZ BAR CONTAINS 12 GRAMS OF PROTEIN

 

Brown Bear Tracks Protein Bar

Brown Bear Back Label

POLAR BEAR TRACKS PROTEIN BAR: Organic White Chocolate with Organic Peanut Butter, Organic Granola and Whey Protein Blend.  Contain 12 Grams of Protein

Due to be released Feb 24, 2013

 

THE PROJECT:

Currently the Bear Tracks Line of Protein Bars is made in a commercial kitchen where I work in a private label relationship. I make the bars but using their Kitchen and License. Perfectly Legal but does not allow me to have the production level I need to expand and more importantly to become CERTIFIED ORGANIC. In this relationship, I am limited to 4 cases of production a week and $5000 in sales ( Organic Labeling Law Exemption ) and will never be able to get the Current Kitchen to get their Kitchen Certified Organic even though everything I do in the production process is within the Organic Guidelines.

I therefore need to get My Own Kitchen re-licensed and Certified Organic. I have used my kitchen before for Olde World Candy but it needs to be updated and modified and be Certified for Organic production.

Once this is done my production can increase to around 20-30 cases per day and I will not be limited by the $5000 rule set forth in The Organic Labeling Laws. I will then be able to continue my conversations with two of the best Distributors in New England to represent the Bear Tracks Line of Protein Bars as well as the Coop organizations and Amazon.

I am in communications now with Whole Foods and Traders Joe's but need to become Certfied Organic with a much larger production Capacity than I currently have to continue with the conversations to have them sell the Bear Tracks Protein Bar Line.

Any Excess funding will go to Bulk Inventory purchases which will reduce my costs and ultimately the Retail Price.

What People are Saying:

"They ( Bear Track Protein Bars ) have no refined ingredients and no sugar added. But don’t let that fool you into thinking they have a bland taste because nothing could be further from the truth!

Each bar is roughly textured for a good strong crunch, but soft so you won’t break your teeth. With each bite a zing of tangy cranberries makes your mouth dance and the light crunch of sunflower seeds and organic rice crisps as the powerful taste of smooth all natural chocolate flood your senses will no doubt put a smile on your face.  For a mere 2 ounce bar you get a whopping 12 grams of high quality, complete protein!

I have had the privilege to sample and buy the first tester batches of the Bear Tracks Protein Bar and I can say without a doubt that my family and I are sold on them. " WWV, Vermont


I will probably also add My Pecan candies at some point also. Check out

http://www.nhmade.com/listdetail.cfm?recordid=3176

For what those are about from when I made them under Olde World Candy

I Sincerely Hope you can see my Vision Also

With Gratitude,

Paul Blann

story:
"I need to vent" she said, "Grenada, is a great country .... BUT the health care there is horrendous. The hospitals leave you waiting for days, there are hardly any Doctors...there is no medication. If there is any, it's sent from family members abroad and shared with many patients."- Tiffany Ford, 2013

This statement pretty much sums up the reason for this campaign. My name is Trisha Mitchell and I am a young Grenadian community activist living in Toronto who has been personally impacted by the severe lack of resources at the Grenada General Hospital. This campaign is the beginning of a plan to ensure that no one else ends up losing a family member like myself or feel the frustration of Tiffany. 

Background:

Grenada is a beautiful island and a vacation favorite for many, but successive hurricanes, Ivan (2004) and Emily (2005) have taken a severe toll on the economy. The hospital in particular was badly damaged and has since deteriorated due to severe funding challenges. Doctors and Nurses have limited access to medication, equipment and supplies needed to perform basic healthcare services.

Read what Doctors from New Jersey had to say here:

“What is commonplace in the United State is non-existent on this island" http://www.nj.com/news/index.ssf/2013/04/nj_doctors_head_to_sudan_to_he.html

 

Hear the anguish of Jennifer's family here:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JphHD_wa0pA

 

How you can help.

The total cost of the shipment is $12,000USD. This campaign is to raise 50% of the cost needed to ship the medication, medical supplies, equipment and a fully equipped ambulance donated to Grenada by IPW WINTERTHUR (The Integrated Psychiatry Winterthur-Zurich).

The items were secured by Mr. Chester Simon, a Grenadian born businessman, living in Switzerland. Valued at over $100, 000USD these supplies are desperately needed by staff at the General hospital.

Any little bit you can donate to help this cause would be greatly appreciated.

Your donation would be a tremendous asset to the people of Grenada.

These supplies would mean the world to a pregnant mother who would now be able to access immediate ambulance services; enable a grand mother to see her grandson grow up and prevent the heartache experienced by my family and many others.

Help us not to have another life claimed by a treatable, manageable disease like diabetes or high blood pressure for lack of proper medication.

The donor has asked that the supplies be moved immediately or they will be donated elsewhere. We need your help to ensure this does not happen.

Please help us spread the word!!

Share, talk to others, call, text, email, Facebook, Tweet, and forward this link to everyone you know, especially to individuals who believe!!!   

We have 45 days to raise $6, 000 so PLEASE HELP US ROCK IT to at least $6, 000 and beyond!!! 

Check out our fantastic REWARDS, including Post cards from Grenada. 

 

THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR CARING!!!
